verses.translation: I shall now declare to you in full this knowledge, both phenomenal and noumenal. This being known, nothing further shall remain for you to know.
verses.transliteration: jñānaṁ te 'haṁ sa-vijñānam idaṁ vakṣyāmy aśeṣataḥ yaj jñātvā neha bhūyo 'nyaj jñātavyam avaśiṣyate
verses.meaning: Krishna promises to reveal complete knowledge, both phenomenal and noumenal, after which nothing more will remain to be known.

verses.sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये। यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः॥
verses.translation: Out of many thousands among men, one may endeavor for perfection, and of those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.
verses.transliteration: manuṣyāṇāṁ sahasreṣu kaścid yatati siddhaye yatatām api siddhānāṁ kaścin māṁ vetti tattvataḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that it is rare for someone to strive for perfection, and even rarer for someone to truly know Him.

verses.sanskrit: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च। अहंकार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा॥
verses.translation: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intelligence and false ego—all together these eight constitute My separated material energies.
verses.transliteration: bhūmir āpo 'nalo vāyuḥ khaṁ mano buddhir eva ca ahaṅkāra itīyaṁ me bhinnā prakṛtir aṣṭadhā
verses.meaning: Krishna describes His separated material energies, which comprise the eight elements of earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intelligence, and false ego.

verses.sanskrit: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम्। जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत्॥
verses.translation: Besides these, O mighty-armed Arjuna, there is another, superior energy of Mine, which comprises the living entities who are exploiting the resources of this material, inferior nature.
verses.transliteration: apareyam itas tv anyāṁ prakṛtiṁ viddhi me parām jīva-bhūtāṁ mahā-bāho yayedaṁ dhāryate jagat
verses.meaning: Krishna speaks of His superior energy, the living entities (jivas), which sustains the material world.

verses.sanskrit: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय। अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा॥
verses.translation: All created beings have their source in these two natures. Of all that is material and all that is spiritual in this world, know for certain that I am both the origin and the dissolution.
verses.transliteration: etad-yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇīty upadhāraya ahaṁ kṛtsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā
verses.meaning: Krishna declares Himself as the origin and dissolution of everything in the material and spiritual worlds.

verses.sanskrit: मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनंजय। मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव॥
verses.translation: O conqueror of wealth, there is no truth superior to Me. Everything rests upon Me, as pearls are strung on a thread.
verses.transliteration: mattaḥ parataraṁ nānyat kiñcid asti dhanañjaya mayi sarvam idaṁ protaṁ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva
verses.meaning: Krishna asserts that there is no higher truth than Him, and that everything rests upon Him, like pearls on a thread.

verses.sanskrit: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः। प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु॥
verses.translation: O son of Kuntī, I am the taste of water, the light of the sun and the moon, the syllable om in the Vedic mantras; I am the sound in ether and ability in man.
verses.transliteration: raso 'ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śaśi-sūryayoḥ praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣu śabdaḥ khe pauruṣaṁ nṛṣu
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the essence of various elements and qualities, such as taste in water, light in the sun and moon, and the sacred syllable Om.

verses.sanskrit: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ। सर्वभूतेषु चास्मि चेतना चेतनेषु॥
verses.translation: I am the fragrance of the earth, and I am the heat in fire. I am the life of all that lives, and I am the penance of all ascetics.
verses.transliteration: puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛthivyāṁ ca tejaś cāsmi vibhāvasau sarva-bhūteṣu cāmi cetanā cetaneṣu
verses.meaning: Krishna further describes Himself as the pure fragrance of the earth, the heat in fire, the life of all beings, and the penance of ascetics.

verses.sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम्। बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्॥
verses.translation: O son of Pṛthā, know that I am the original seed of all that exists—the intelligence of the intelligent and the prowess of the powerful.
verses.transliteration: bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārtha sanātanam buddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
verses.meaning: Krishna declares Himself as the eternal seed of all existence, the intelligence of the intelligent, and the prowess of the powerful.

verses.sanskrit: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम्। धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ॥
verses.translation: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of passion and desire. O lord of the Bhāratas, I am the sexual principle which is not contrary to religious principles.
verses.transliteration: balaṁ balavatāṁ cāhaṁ kāma-rāga-vivarjitam dharmāviruddho bhūteṣu kāmo 'smi bharatarṣabha
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the strength of the strong, free from passion and desire, and as the desire that aligns with dharma.

verses.sanskrit: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये। मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि॥
verses.translation: Know that all states of being—whether goodness, passion or ignorance—are manifested by My energy. I am, in one sense, everything, but I am independent. I am not under the modes of material nature.
verses.transliteration: ye caiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāś ca ye matta eveti tān viddhi na tv ahaṁ teṣu te mayi
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that all states of being arise from His energy, but He remains independent and is not affected by the modes of material nature.

verses.sanskrit: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत्। मोहितं न जानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम्॥
verses.translation: Deluded by the three modes [goodness, passion and ignorance], the whole world does not know Me, who am above the modes and inexhaustible.
verses.transliteration: tribhir guṇa-mayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṁ jagat mohitaṁ na jānāti mām ebhyaḥ param avyayam
verses.meaning: Krishna says that the world is deluded by the three modes and thus fails to recognize Him as the transcendental and inexhaustible Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया। मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते॥
verses.translation: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes of material nature, is difficult to overcome. But those who have surrendered unto Me can easily cross beyond it.
verses.transliteration: daivī hy eṣā guṇa-mayī mama māyā duratyayā mām eva ye prapadyante māyām etāṁ taranti te
verses.meaning: Krishna describes His divine energy (maya), composed of the three modes, as difficult to overcome, but those who surrender to Him can transcend it.

verses.sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः। माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः॥
verses.translation: Those miscreants who are grossly foolish, who are lowest among mankind, whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and who partake of the atheistic nature of demons do not surrender unto Me.
verses.transliteration: na māṁ duṣkṛtino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ māyayāpahṛta-jñānā āsuraṁ bhāvam āśritāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna states that miscreants, the foolish, the lowest of mankind, those whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and those of demonic nature do not surrender to Him.

verses.sanskrit: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन। आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ॥
verses.translation: O best of the Bhāratas, four kinds of pious men begin to render devotional service unto Me—the distressed, the desirer of wealth, the inquisitive, and he who is searching for knowledge.
verses.transliteration: catur-vidhā bhajante māṁ janāḥ sukṛtino 'rjuna ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī ca bharatarṣabha
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the four types of righteous people who begin to worship Him: the distressed, the seeker of wealth, the inquisitive, and the seeker of knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते। प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः॥
verses.translation: Of these, the one who is in full knowledge and who is always engaged in pure devotional service is the best. For I am very dear to him, and he is dear to Me.
verses.transliteration: teṣāṁ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśiṣyate priyo hi jñānino 'tyartham ahaṁ sa ca mama priyaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna says that the one with full knowledge, who is always in pure devotional service, is the best. He is very dear to Krishna, and Krishna is dear to him.

verses.sanskrit: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम्। आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम्॥
verses.translation: All these devotees are undoubtedly magnanimous souls, but he who is situated in knowledge of Me I consider to be just like Myself. Being engaged in My transcendental service, he is sure to attain Me, the supreme goal.
verses.transliteration: udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tv ātmaiva me matam āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṁ gatim
verses.meaning: Krishna regards all devotees as magnanimous but considers the one with knowledge of Him as being like Himself, destined to attain the supreme goal.

verses.sanskrit: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते। वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः॥
verses.translation: After many births and deaths, he who is actually in knowledge surrenders unto Me, knowing Me to be the cause of all causes and all that exists. Such a great soul is very rare.
verses.transliteration: bahūnāṁ janmanām ante jñānavān māṁ prapadyate vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su-durlabhaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that after many births, a person in true knowledge surrenders to Him, recognizing Him as the cause of all causes. Such a great soul is very rare.

verses.sanskrit: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानास्ते ते देवतापरायणाः। ये ये नियताः स्वया प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया॥
verses.translation: Those whose intelligence has been stolen by material desires surrender unto demigods and follow the different rules of worship according to their own natures.
verses.transliteration: kāmais tais tair hṛta-jñānās te te devatā-parāyaṇāḥ ye ye niyamāḥ svayā prakṛtyā niyatāḥ svayā
verses.meaning: Krishna says that those whose intelligence is stolen by desires worship demigods, following specific rules according to their nature.

verses.sanskrit: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति। तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम्॥
verses.translation: I am in everyone's heart as the Supersoul. As soon as one desires to worship some demigod, I make his faith steady so that he can devote himself to that particular deity.
verses.transliteration: yo yo yāṁ yāṁ tanuṁ bhaktaḥ śraddhayārcitum icchati tasya tasyācalāṁ śraddhāṁ tām eva vidadhāmy aham
verses.meaning: Krishna, as the Supersoul, stabilizes the faith of those who desire to worship a particular deity.

verses.sanskrit: स तया श्रद्धया तस्य तस्याराधनमीहते। लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान्॥
verses.translation: Endowed with such a faith, he endeavors to worship a particular demigod and obtains his desires. But in actuality these benefits are bestowed by Me alone.
verses.transliteration: sa tayā śraddhayā tasya tasyārādhanam īhate labhate ca tataḥ kāmān mayāiva vihitān hi tān
verses.meaning: Krishna clarifies that while one may worship a demigod and fulfill desires, it is He who ultimately bestows those benefits.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम्। देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि॥
verses.translation: Men of little intelligence worship the demigods, and their fruits are limited and temporary. Those who worship the demigods attain the planets of the demigods, but My devotees ultimately reach My supreme planet.
verses.transliteration: antavat tu phalaṁ teṣāṁ tad bhavaty alpa-medhasām devān deva-yajo yānti mad-bhaktā yānti mām api
verses.meaning: Krishna contrasts the temporary and limited results of demigod worship with the eternal attainment of Himself by His devotees.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः। परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम्॥
verses.translation: Unintelligent men, who do not know Me perfectly, think that I, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, was impersonal before and have now assumed this personality. Due to their little knowledge, they do not know My higher nature, which is imperishable and supreme.
verses.transliteration: avyaktaṁ vyaktim āpannaṁ manyante mām abuddhayaḥ paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mamāvyayam anuttamam
verses.meaning: Krishna says that the unintelligent, not knowing Him perfectly, believe He was impersonal before assuming a personality, unaware of His imperishable and supreme nature.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः। मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम्॥
verses.translation: I am never manifest to the foolish and unintelligent. For them I am covered by My eternal creative potency [yoga-māyā]; and so the deluded world knows Me not, who am unborn and infallible.
verses.transliteration: nāhaṁ prakāśaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛtaḥ mūḍho 'yaṁ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that He is veiled from the foolish and unintelligent by His yoga-maya, and thus, they do not recognize Him as unborn and infallible.

verses.sanskrit: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन। भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन॥
verses.translation: O Arjuna, as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, I know everything that has happened in the past, all that is happening in the present, and all things that are yet to come. I also know all living entities; but Me, no one knows.
verses.transliteration: vedāhaṁ samatītāni vartamānāni cārjuna bhaviṣyāṇi ca bhūtāni māṁ tu veda na kaścana
verses.meaning: Krishna declares that as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, He knows the past, present, and future, and all living beings, but no one knows Him.

verses.sanskrit: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत। सर्वभूतानि संमोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप॥
verses.translation: O scion of Bharata, O conqueror of the foe, all living entities are born into delusion, bewildered by the dualities of desire and hate.
verses.transliteration: icchā-dveṣa-samutthena dvandva-mohena bhārata sarva-bhūtāni saṁmohaṁ sarge yānti paran-tapa
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that living beings are born into delusion, bewildered by the dualities of desire and hate.

verses.sanskrit: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम्। ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः॥
verses.translation: Persons who have acted piously in previous lives and in this life, whose sinful actions are completely eradicated and who are freed from the duality of delusion, engage themselves in My devotional service with determination.
verses.transliteration: yeṣāṁ tv anta-gataṁ pāpaṁ janānāṁ puṇya-karmaṇām te dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṁ dṛḍha-vratāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes those who engage in His devotional service with determination: they are freed from duality, their sins are eradicated, and they have acted piously.

verses.sanskrit: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामश्रित्य यतन्ति ये। ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम्॥
verses.translation: Intelligent persons who are endeavoring for liberation from old age and death take refuge in Me in devotional service. They are actually Brahman, for they know everything about transcendental activities.
verses.transliteration: jarā-maraṇa-mokṣāya mām āśritya yatanti ye te brahma tad viduḥ kṛtsnam adhyātmaṁ karma cākhilam
verses.meaning: Krishna states that those who seek liberation from old age and death by taking refuge in Him understand Brahman, the entirety of transcendental activities.

verses.sanskrit: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः। प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः॥
verses.translation: Those in full consciousness of Me, who know Me, the Supreme Lord, to be the governing principle of the material manifestation, of the demigods, and of all methods of sacrifice, can understand and know Me, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, even at the time of death.
verses.transliteration: sādhibhūtādhidaivaṁ māṁ sādhiyajñaṁ ca ye viduḥ prayāṇa-kāle 'pi ca māṁ te vidur yukta-cetasaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna concludes by saying that those who are in full consciousness of Him, knowing Him as the governing principle of everything, can understand Him even at the time of death.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम। अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते॥
verses.translation: Arjuna inquired: O my Lord, O Supreme Person, what is Brahman? What is the self? What are fruitive activities? What are these material manifestations? And what are the demigods?
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca kiṁ tad brahma kim adhyātmaṁ kiṁ karma puruṣottama adhibhūtaṁ ca kiṁ proktam adhidaivaṁ kim ucyate
verses.meaning: Arjuna poses several questions to Krishna, inquiring about the nature of Brahman, the self, fruitive activities, material manifestations, and demigods.

verses.sanskrit: अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन। प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः॥
verses.translation: How does this Lord of sacrifice live in the body, and in which part of it does He reside? And how can those engaged in devotional service know You at the time of death?
verses.transliteration: adhiyajñaḥ kathaṁ ko 'tra dehe 'smin madhusūdana prayāṇa-kāle ca kathaṁ jñeyo 'si niyatātmabhiḥ
verses.meaning: Arjuna continues his questions, asking about the Lord of sacrifice in the body and how devotees can know Krishna at the time of death.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते। भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: The indestructible, transcendental living entity is called Brahman, and self-realization is called adhyātma. Action pertaining to the development of the material bodies of the living entities is called karma, or fruitive activities.
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca akṣaraṁ brahma paramaṁ svabhāvo 'dhyātmam ucyate bhūta-bhāvodbhava-karo visargaḥ karma-saṁjñitaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna begins to answer, defining Brahman, adhyatma, and karma.

verses.sanskrit: अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम्। अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर॥
verses.translation: O best of the embodied beings, the physical nature, which is constantly changing, is called adhibhūta [the material manifestation]. The universal form of the Lord, which includes all the demigods, like the sun and moon, is called adhidaiva. And I, as the Supreme Lord, represented as the Supersoul in the heart of every embodied being, am called adhiyajña [the Lord of sacrifice].
verses.transliteration: adhibhūtaṁ kṣaro bhāvaḥ puruṣaś cādhidaivatam adhiyajño 'ham evātra dehe deha-bhṛtāṁ vara
verses.meaning: Krishna defines adhibhuta, adhidaiva, and adhiyajna, explaining His presence as the Supersoul.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम्। यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः॥
verses.translation: And whoever, at the time of death, quits his body, remembering Me alone, at once attains My nature. Of this there is no doubt.
verses.transliteration: anta-kāle ca mām eva smaran muktvā kalevaram yaḥ prayāti sa mad-bhāvaṁ yāti nāsty atra saṁśayaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna emphasizes the importance of remembering Him at the time of death to attain His nature.

verses.sanskrit: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम्। तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः॥
verses.translation: Whatever state of being one remembers when he quits his body, O son of Kuntī, that state he will attain without fail.
verses.transliteration: yaṁ yaṁ vāpi smaran bhāvaṁ tyajaty ante kalevaram taṁ tam evaiti kaunteya sadā tad-bhāva-bhāvitaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that the state of mind at the time of death determines one's next life.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च। मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयम्॥
verses.translation: Therefore, Arjuna, you should always think of Me, and at the same time carry out your prescribed duty of fighting. With your mind and intelligence fixed on Me, you will undoubtedly come to Me.
verses.transliteration: tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu mām anusmara yudhya ca mayy arpita-mano-buddhir mām evaiṣyasy asaṁśayam
verses.meaning: Krishna advises Arjuna to constantly remember Him while performing his duties, assuring that this will lead to attaining Him.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना। परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन्॥
verses.translation: He who meditates on Me with his mind constantly engaged in remembering Me, undeviating from the path, O Pārtha, he attains the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
verses.transliteration: abhyāsa-yoga-yuktena cetasā nānya-gāminā paramaṁ puruṣaṁ divyaṁ yāti pārthānucintayan
verses.meaning: Krishna describes how one who constantly remembers Him with an undeviating mind attains the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

verses.sanskrit: कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः। सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात्॥
verses.translation: One should meditate upon the Supreme Person as the one who knows everything, who is the oldest, who is the controller, who is smaller than the smallest, who is the maintainer of everything, who is beyond all material conception, who is inconceivable, and who is always a person. He is luminous like the sun, and He is transcendental, beyond this material nature.
verses.transliteration: kaviṁ purāṇam anuśāsitāram aṇor aṇīyāṁsam anusmared yaḥ sarvasya dhātāram acintya-rūpam āditya-varṇaṁ tamasaḥ parastāt
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the qualities of the Supreme Person, emphasizing His omniscience, eternality, control, subtlety, and transcendental nature.

verses.sanskrit: प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव। भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम्॥
verses.translation: Those who, at the time of death, fix their life air between the eyebrows and then, with perfect devotion, engage themselves in remembering the Supreme Lord, will certainly attain to Him.
verses.transliteration: prayāṇa-kāle manasācalena bhaktyā yukto yoga-balena caiva bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśya samyak sa taṁ paraṁ puruṣam upaiti divyam
verses.meaning: Krishna explains the process of fixing the life air between the eyebrows at the time of death, with devotion, to attain the Supreme Lord.

verses.sanskrit: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः। यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं सङ्ग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये॥
verses.translation: Persons who are learned in the Vedas, who utter omkāra, who are great sages in the renounced order of life, enter into Brahman. Desiring such perfection, one practices celibacy. Now I shall explain to you in a few words that process by which one may attain this perfection.
verses.transliteration: yad akṣaraṁ veda-vido vadanti viśanti yaj yatayo vīta-rāgāḥ yad icchanto brahmacaryaṁ caranti tat te padaṁ saṅgraheṇa pravakṣye
verses.meaning: Krishna describes how those learned in the Vedas, uttering Omkara, and the renounced, enter Brahman, and He summarizes the process to attain this perfection.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च। मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम्॥
verses.translation: One who at the time of death closes all the doors of the senses and fixes the mind on the heart and concentrates his life air at the top of the head and, being established in yogic meditation, utters the sacred syllable om, the supreme combination of letters—if he departs from his body in that consciousness, he will certainly reach the supreme goal.
verses.transliteration: sarva-dvārāṇi saṁyamya mano hṛdi nirudhya ca mūrdhny ādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yoga-dhāraṇām
verses.meaning: Krishna elaborates on the process of leaving the body in yogic meditation, uttering Om, to reach the supreme goal.

verses.sanskrit: ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन्। यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम्॥
verses.translation: (same as previous verse)
verses.transliteration: om ity ekākṣaraṁ brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran yaḥ prayāti tyajan dehaṁ sa yāti paramāṁ gatim
verses.meaning: (same as previous verse) This verse reiterates the importance of uttering Om and remembering Krishna when departing from the body.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः। तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः॥
verses.translation: For one who always remembers Me without deviation, I am easy to obtain, O son of Pṛthā, because of his constant engagement in devotional service.
verses.transliteration: ananya-cetāḥ satataṁ yo māṁ smarati nityaśaḥ tasyāhaṁ sulabhaḥ pārtha nitya-yuktasya yoginaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna assures that He is easily attained by one who constantly remembers Him with undeviating devotion.

verses.sanskrit: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम्। नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः॥
verses.translation: After attaining Me, the great souls, who are yogīs in devotion, never return to this temporary world, which is full of misery, because they have attained the highest perfection.
verses.transliteration: mām upetya punar janma duḥkhālayam aśāśvatam nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṁsiddhiṁ paramāṁ gatāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna states that great souls who attain Him do not return to the miserable, temporary material world, having reached the highest perfection.

verses.sanskrit: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन। मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते॥
verses.translation: From the highest planet in the material world down to the lowest, all are places of misery where repeated birth and death take place. But one who attains to My abode, O son of Kuntī, never takes birth again.
verses.transliteration: ā-brahma-bhuvanāl lokāḥ punar āvartino 'rjuna mām upetya tu kaunteya punar janma na vidyate
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that all planets in the material world are places of misery with rebirth, but attaining His abode leads to no more rebirth.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद् ब्रह्मणो विदुः। रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः॥
verses.translation: By human calculation, a thousand ages equal one day of Brahmā. And such also is the duration of his night.
verses.transliteration: sahasra-yuga-paryantam ahar yad brahmaṇo viduḥ rātriṁ yuga-sahasrāntāṁ te 'ho-rātra-vido janāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the vast timescale of Brahma's day and night, each lasting a thousand ages.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे। रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके॥
verses.translation: At the beginning of Brahmā's day, all living entities become manifest from the unmanifest, and thereafter, at the fall of Brahmā’s night, they are merged into the unmanifest again.
verses.transliteration: avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavanty ahar-āgame rātry-āgame pralīyante tatraivāvyakta-saṁjñake
verses.meaning: Krishna explains how all living entities emerge from the unmanifest at the start of Brahma's day and merge back into it at night.

verses.sanskrit: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते। रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे॥
verses.translation: Again and again the day comes, and all living beings become active; and again the night falls, and they are helplessly dissolved.
verses.transliteration: bhūta-grāmaḥ sa evāyaṁ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyate rātry-āgame 'vaśaḥ pārtha prabhavaty ahar-āgame
verses.meaning: Krishna reiterates the cycle of living beings becoming active at the day's onset and dissolving helplessly at night.

verses.sanskrit: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः। यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति॥
verses.translation: Yet there is another unmanifest nature, which is eternal and is transcendental to this manifested and unmanifested matter. It is supreme and is never annihilated. When all in this world is annihilated, that part remains as it is.
verses.transliteration: paras tasmāt tu bhāvo 'nyo 'vyakto 'vyaktāt sanātanaḥ yaḥ sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu naśyatsu na vinaśyati
verses.meaning: Krishna speaks of another eternal, unmanifest nature, transcendental to both manifest and unmanifest matter, which remains even when all else is destroyed.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम्। यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम॥
verses.translation: That which the Vedāntists describe as unmanifest and infallible, that which is known as the supreme destination, that place from which, having attained it, one never returns—that is My supreme abode.
verses.transliteration: avyakto 'kṣara ity uktas tam āhuḥ paramāṁ gatim yaṁ prāpya na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies the unmanifest, infallible state as the supreme destination, His own abode, from which one never returns.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया भक्त्या। यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is greater than all, is attainable by unalloyed devotion. Although He is present in His abode, He is all-pervading, and everything rests upon Him.
verses.transliteration: puruṣaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha labhyas tv ananyayā bhaktyā yasyāntaḥ-sthāni bhūtāni yena sarvam idaṁ tatam
verses.meaning: Krishna states that the Supreme Personality of Godhead is attainable by unalloyed devotion. He is all-pervading, and everything rests upon Him.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः। प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ॥
verses.translation: O best of the Bhāratas, I shall now explain to you the different times at which, if the transcendentalist departs from this world, he will either go back to the spiritual world or not return.
verses.transliteration: yatra kāle tv anāvṛttim āvṛttiṁ caiva yoginaḥ prayātā yānti taṁ kālaṁ vakṣyāmi bharatarṣabha
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the different times of departure from the world for a transcendentalist, affecting their return or non-return.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम्। तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः॥
verses.translation: Those who know the Supreme Brahman attain that Supreme by departing from the body during the influence of the fire-god, in the light, at an auspicious moment of the day, during the fortnight of the waxing moon, or during the six months when the sun passes in the northern hemisphere.
verses.transliteration: agnir jyotir ahaḥ śuklaḥ ṣaṇ-māsā uttarāyaṇam tatra prayātā gacchanti brahma brahma-vido janāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that departing under specific auspicious conditions like fire, light, and the sun's northern course leads to attaining Brahman.

verses.sanskrit: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम्। तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते॥
verses.translation: The yogī who passes away from this world during the smoke, in the night, during the fortnight of the waning moon, or in the six months when the sun passes to the southern hemisphere, reaches the moon planet but again comes back.
verses.transliteration: dhūmo rātris tathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṇ-māsā dakṣiṇāyanam tatra cāndramasaṁ jyotir yogī prāpya nivartate
verses.meaning: Krishna contrasts this, stating that departing under conditions like smoke, night, and the sun's southern course leads to reaching the moon and subsequent return.

verses.sanskrit: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते। एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः॥
verses.translation: According to Vedic opinion, there are only two ways of passing from this world—one in light and one in darkness. When one passes in light, he does not come back; but when one passes in darkness, he returns.
verses.transliteration: śukla-kṛṣṇe gatī hy ete jagataḥ śāśvate mate ekayā yāty anāvṛttim anyayāvartate punaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna summarizes that the two paths—light and darkness—determine whether one returns or not.

verses.sanskrit: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन् योगी मुह्यति कश्चन। तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन॥
verses.translation: Although the devotees know these two paths, O Arjuna, they are never bewildered. Therefore be always fixed in devotion.
verses.transliteration: naite sṛtī pārtha jānan yogī muhyati kaścana tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu yoga-yukto bhavārjuna
verses.meaning: Krishna advises Arjuna to remain fixed in devotion at all times, as devotees who know these paths are never bewildered.

verses.sanskrit: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम्। अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम्॥
verses.translation: The yogī who knows all this attains to the supreme primeval abode. He surpasses all the results derived from studying the Vedas, performing sacrifices, undergoing austerities, giving charity, and so on. By understanding this, he attains the supreme eternal abode.
verses.transliteration: vedeṣu yajñeṣu tapaḥsu caiva dāneṣu yat puṇya-phalaṁ pradiṣṭam atyeti tat sarvam idaṁ viditvā yogī paraṁ sthānam upaiti cādyam
verses.meaning: Krishna concludes by stating that the yogi who understands this knowledge surpasses all Vedic merits and attains the supreme, eternal abode.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे। ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात्॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: My dear Arjuna, because you are never envious of Me, I shall impart to you this most confidential knowledge and realization, by knowing which you shall be freed from the miseries of material existence.
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca idaṁ tu te guhyatamaṁ pravakṣyāmy anasūyave jñānaṁ vijñāna-sahitaṁ yaj jñātvā mokṣyase 'śubhāt
verses.meaning: Krishna promises to reveal the most confidential knowledge to Arjuna, because he is not envious, and explains that this knowledge will free him from material miseries.

verses.sanskrit: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम्। प्रत्यक्षಾವಗಮಂ धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम्॥
verses.translation: This knowledge is the king of education, the most secret of all secrets. It is the purest knowledge, and because it gives direct perception of the self by realization, it is the perfection of religion. It is everlasting, and it is joyfully performed.
verses.transliteration: rāja-vidyā rāja-guhyaṁ pavitram idam uttamam pratyakṣāvagamaṁ dharmyaṁ su-sukhaṁ kartum avyayam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes this knowledge as the king of education, the most secret, the purest, the perfection of religion, everlasting, and joyful to perform.

verses.sanskrit: अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुष धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप। अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि॥
verses.translation: Those who are not faithful in this devotional service cannot attain Me, O conqueror of enemies. Therefore they return to the path of birth and death in this material world.
verses.transliteration: aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣā dharmasyāsya paran-tapa aprāpya māṁ nivartante mṛtyu-saṁsāra-vartmani
verses.meaning: Krishna states that those without faith in devotional service cannot attain Him and remain on the path of birth and death.

verses.sanskrit: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना। मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः॥
verses.translation: By Me, in My unmanifested form, this entire universe is pervaded. All beings are in Me, but I am not in them.
verses.transliteration: mayā tatam idaṁ sarvaṁ jagad avyakta-mūrtinā mat-sthāni sarva-bhūtāni na cāhaṁ teṣv avasthitaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that the entire universe is pervaded by His unmanifested form. All beings are in Him, but He is not in them.

verses.sanskrit: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्। भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः॥
verses.translation: And yet everything that is created does not rest in Me. Behold My mystic potency! Although I am the maintainer of all living entities, and although I am everywhere, I am not in cosmic manifestation.
verses.transliteration: na ca mat-sthāni bhūtāni paśya me yogam aiśvaram bhūta-bhṛn na ca bhūta-stho mamātmā bhūta-bhāvanaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna emphasizes His mystic potency, stating that while He maintains all beings and is everywhere, He is not in the cosmic manifestation.

verses.sanskrit: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान्। तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानित्युपधारय॥
verses.translation: Know that as the mighty wind, blowing everywhere, always rests in the sky, all created beings rest in Me in the same way.
verses.transliteration: yathākāśa-sthito nityaṁ vāyuḥ sarvatra-go mahān tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mat-sthānīty upadhāraya
verses.meaning: Krishna uses the analogy of the wind resting in the sky to illustrate how all created beings rest in Him.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम्। कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम्॥
verses.translation: O son of Kuntī, at the end of the millennium all created beings enter into My nature. At the beginning of another millennium, by My potency, I create them again.
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṁ yānti māmikām kalpa-kṣaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛjāmy aham
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the cycle of creation and dissolution: at the end of a millennium, beings enter His nature, and at the beginning of the next, He recreates them.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः। भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात्॥
verses.translation: The whole cosmic order is under Me. By My will it is manifested again and again, and by My will it is annihilated at the end.
verses.transliteration: prakṛtiṁ svām avaṣṭabhya visṛjāmi punaḥ punaḥ bhūta-grāmam imaṁ kṛtsnam avaśaṁ prakṛter vaśāt
verses.meaning: Krishna affirms that the entire cosmic order is under His control, manifested and annihilated by His will.

verses.sanskrit: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनंजय। उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु॥
verses.translation: O Dhanañjaya, all these activities do not bind Me. I am ever detached, seated as if neutral.
verses.transliteration: na ca māṁ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya udāsīnavad āsīnam asaktaṁ teṣu karmasu
verses.meaning: Krishna asserts that these activities do not bind Him; He remains detached and neutral.

verses.sanskrit: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम्। हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते॥
verses.translation: This material nature, which is one of My energies, is working under My direction, O son of Kuntī, producing all moving and nonmoving beings. By its rule this manifestation is created and annihilated again and again.
verses.transliteration: mayādhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sa-carācaram hetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that material nature, as one of His energies, works under His direction to produce all beings, and by its rule, the world is repeatedly created and destroyed.

verses.sanskrit: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम्। परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम्॥
verses.translation: The foolish deride Me, thinking Me to be a human being. They do not know My transcendental nature as the Supreme Lord of all that be.
verses.transliteration: avajānanti māṁ mūḍhā mānuṣīṁ tanum āśritam paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśvaram
verses.meaning: Krishna says that the foolish deride Him, not knowing His transcendental nature as the Supreme Lord.

verses.sanskrit: मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः। राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः॥
verses.translation: Those who are thus bewildered are attracted by demoniac and atheistic views. In that deluded condition, their hopes for liberation, their fruitive activities, and their cultivation of knowledge are all defeated.
verses.transliteration: moghāśā mogha-karmāṇo mogha-jñānā vicetasaḥ rākṣasīm āsurīṁ caiva prakṛtiṁ mohinīṁ śritāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the deluded as having demoniac and atheistic views, leading to defeated hopes, fruitive activities, and knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः। भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम्॥
verses.translation: O son of Pṛthā, those who are not deluded, the great souls, are under the protection of the divine nature. They are fully engaged in devotional service, knowing Me as the Supreme Personality of Godhead, original and inexhaustible.
verses.transliteration: mahātmānas tu māṁ pārtha daivīṁ prakṛtim āśritāḥ bhajanty ananya-manaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam
verses.meaning: Krishna contrasts the undeluded great souls who, under divine protection, devote themselves to Him as the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

verses.sanskrit: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः। नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते॥
verses.translation: Always chanting My glories, endeavoring with great determination, bowing down before Me, these great souls constantly worship Me with steadfast devotion.
verses.transliteration: satataṁ kīrtayanto māṁ yatantaś ca dṛḍha-vratāḥ namasyantaś ca māṁ bhaktyā nitya-yuktā upāsate
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the continuous worship of the great souls through chanting His glories, endeavoring with determination, and offering devotion.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते। एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम्॥
verses.translation: Others, who engage in the cultivation of knowledge, worship the Supreme Lord by offering different kinds of sacrifice—some of them worship the undivided one, some the many divided ones, and others the universal form of the Lord.
verses.transliteration: jñāna-yajñena cāpy anye yajanto mām upāsate ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśvato-mukham
verses.meaning: Krishna mentions that others worship Him through the cultivation of knowledge, offering different sacrifices, and perceiving Him in oneness, division, or the universal form.

verses.sanskrit: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम्। मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम्॥
verses.translation: But it is I who am the ritual, I the sacrifice, the offering to the ancestors, the healing herb, the mantra. I am the clarified butter, the fire and the offering.
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ kratur ahaṁ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣadham mantro 'ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṁ hutam
verses.meaning: Krishna declares Himself to be the essence of various aspects of worship and sacrifice, including the ritual, sacrifice, offering, herb, mantra, butter, fire, and oblation.

verses.sanskrit: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता পিতামहः। वेद्यं पवित्रमोङ्कार ऋक्साम यजुरप्यहम्॥
verses.translation: I am the father of this universe, the mother, the support and the grandsire. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier and the syllable om. I am also the Ṛg, the Sāma, and the Yajur.
verses.transliteration: pitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ vedyaṁ pavitram oṁkāra ṛk sāma yajur apy aham
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the father, mother, support, grandsire, object of knowledge, purifier, the syllable Om, and the three Vedas.

verses.sanskrit: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत्। प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम्॥
verses.translation: I am the goal, the sustainer, the master, the witness, the abode, the refuge, and the most dear friend. I am the creation and the annihilation, the basis of everything, the resting place and the eternal seed.
verses.transliteration: gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣī nivāsaḥ śaraṇaṁ suhṛt prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṁ nidhānaṁ bījam avyayam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes Himself as the ultimate goal, sustainer, master, witness, refuge, friend, and the source of creation, annihilation, and the eternal seed.

verses.sanskrit: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णामि सृजामि च। अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन॥
verses.translation: O Arjuna, I give heat, and I withhold and send forth the rain. I am immortality, and I am also death personified. Both spirit and matter are in Me.
verses.transliteration: tapāmy aham ahaṁ varṣaṁ nigṛhṇāmi sṛjāmi ca amṛtaṁ caiva mṛtyuś ca sad asac cāham arjuna
verses.meaning: Krishna says that He gives heat, controls rain, and is both immortality and death, as well as spirit and matter.

verses.sanskrit: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते। ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकमश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान्॥
verses.translation: Those who study the Vedas and drink the soma juice, seeking heavenly planets, worship Me indirectly. Purified from sinful reactions, they take birth on the pious heavenly planets, where they enjoy exquisite sense pleasures.
verses.transliteration: traividyā māṁ soma-pāḥ pūta-pāpā yajñair iṣṭvā svar-gatiṁ prārthayante te puṇyam āsādya surendra-lokam aśnanti divyān divi deva-bhogān
verses.meaning: Krishna describes those who seek heavenly pleasures through Vedic study and soma, and attain those pleasures after purification from sins.

verses.sanskrit: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति। एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते॥
verses.translation: When they have thus enjoyed vast heavenly sense pleasure, the results of their pious activities are exhausted, and then they return to this mortal planet again. Thus those who seek sense enjoyment by adhering to the principles of the three Vedas achieve only repeated birth and death.
verses.transliteration: te taṁ bhuktvā svarga-lokaṁ viśālaṁ kṣīṇe puṇye martya-lokaṁ viśanti evaṁ trayī-dharmam anuprapannā gatāgataṁ kāma-kāmā labhante
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that after enjoying heavenly pleasures, the results of pious deeds are exhausted, leading to a return to the mortal world, thus achieving only repeated birth and death.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते। तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम्॥
verses.translation: But those who always worship Me with exclusive devotion, meditating on My transcendental form—to them I carry what they lack, and I preserve what they have.
verses.transliteration: ananyāś cintayanto māṁ ye janāḥ paryupāsate teṣāṁ nityābhiyuktānāṁ yoga-kṣemaṁ vahāmy aham
verses.meaning: Krishna promises to take care of the needs and preserve the possessions of those who worship Him with exclusive devotion.

verses.sanskrit: येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः। तेऽपि मामेव यजन्ति विधिपूर्वकम्॥
verses.translation: Those who are devotees of other gods and worship them with faith actually worship only Me, O son of Kuntī, but they do so in a wrong way.
verses.transliteration: ye 'py anya-devatā bhaktā yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ te 'pi mām eva yajanti avidhi-pūrvakam
verses.meaning: Krishna states that even those who worship other gods with faith are ultimately worshipping Him, but in an improper way.

verses.sanskrit: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च। न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनतश्च्यवन्ति ते॥
verses.translation: I am the only enjoyer and the master of all sacrifices. Therefore, those who do not recognize My true transcendental nature fall down.
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ hi sarva-yajñānāṁ bhoktā ca prabhur eva ca na tu mām abhijānanti tattvenātaś cyavanti te
verses.meaning: Krishna emphasizes that He is the enjoyer and master of all sacrifices, and those who do not recognize His true nature fall down.

verses.sanskrit: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः। भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम्॥
verses.translation: Those who worship the demigods will take birth among the demigods; those who worship the ancestors go to the ancestors; those who worship ghosts take birth among such beings; and those who worship Me will live with Me.
verses.transliteration: yānti deva-vratā devān pitṝn yānti pitṛ-vratāḥ bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti mad-yājino 'pi mām
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the destinations of various worshippers: demigods, ancestors, ghosts, and ultimately, Himself.

verses.sanskrit: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति। तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः॥
verses.translation: If one offers Me with love and devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit or water, I will accept it.
verses.transliteration: patraṁ puṣpaṁ phalaṁ toyaṁ yo me bhaktyā prayacchati tad ahaṁ bhakty-upahṛtam aśnāmi prayatātmanaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna expresses His willingness to accept even the simplest offerings made with love and devotion.

verses.sanskrit: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत्। यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम्॥
verses.translation: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer or give away, and whatever austerities you perform—do that as an offering to Me.
verses.transliteration: yat karoṣi yad aśnāsi yaj juhoṣi dadāsi yat yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva mad-arpaṇam
verses.meaning: Krishna advises Arjuna to perform all actions, including eating, offering, giving, and austerities, as offerings to Him.

verses.sanskrit: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः। संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि॥
verses.translation: In that way you will be freed from all reactions to good and evil deeds, and by this renunciation you will attain liberation and come to Me.
verses.transliteration: śubhāśubha-phalair evaṁ mokṣyase karma-bandhanaiḥ saṁnyāsa-yoga-yuktātmā vimukto mām upaiṣyasi
verses.meaning: Krishna promises that by performing actions as offerings, one will be freed from karmic reactions, attain liberation, and ultimately reach Him.

verses.sanskrit: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः। ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम्॥
verses.translation: I envy no one, nor am I partial to anyone. I am equal to all. But whoever renders service unto Me in devotion is a friend, is in Me, and I am also a friend to him.
verses.transliteration: samo 'haṁ sarva-bhūteṣu na me dveṣyo 'sti na priyaḥ ye bhajanti tu māṁ bhaktyā mayi te teṣu cāpy aham
verses.meaning: Krishna affirms His impartiality towards all beings, but emphasizes His special relationship with those who serve Him with devotion.

verses.sanskrit: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक्। साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः॥
verses.translation: Even if one commits the most abominable actions, if he is engaged in undeviating devotional service, he is to be considered saintly because he is properly situated in his determination.
verses.transliteration: api cet su-durācāro bhajate mām ananya-bhāk sādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna declares that even a person committing terrible acts is considered saintly if devoted to Him with determination.

verses.sanskrit: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति। कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति॥
verses.translation: He quickly becomes righteous and attains lasting peace. O son of Kuntī, declare it boldly that My devotee never perishes.
verses.transliteration: kṣipraṁ bhavati dharmātmā śaśvac chāntiṁ nigacchati kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati
verses.meaning: Krishna asserts that His devotee quickly becomes righteous and attains lasting peace, and He urges Arjuna to declare that His devotee never perishes.

verses.sanskrit: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः। स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम्॥
verses.translation: O son of Pṛthā, those who take shelter in Me, though they be of low birth—women, vaiśyas [merchants], as well as śūdras [workers]—can approach the supreme destination.
verses.transliteration: māṁ hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye 'pi syuḥ pāpa-yonayaḥ striyo vaiśyās tathā śūdrās te 'pi yānti parāṁ gatim
verses.meaning: Krishna states that anyone, regardless of social status or birth, can attain the supreme destination by taking shelter in Him.

verses.sanskrit: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा। अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम्॥
verses.translation: How much greater then are the pious brāhmaṇas, the devoted kings and the perfect men! Having come to this temporary, miserable world, engage in My devotional service.
verses.transliteration: kiṁ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣayas tathā anityam asukhaṁ lokam imaṁ prāpya bhajasva mām
verses.meaning: Krishna emphasizes the importance of devotional service, especially for the pious, the devoted kings, and the perfect men, who have come to this temporary and miserable world.

verses.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु। मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः॥
verses.translation: Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, become My devotee, offer obeisances to Me and worship Me. Being completely absorbed in Me, surely you will come to Me.
verses.transliteration: man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru mām evaiṣyasi yuktvaivam ātmānaṁ mat-parāyaṇaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna concludes this section by urging Arjuna to fix his mind on Him, become His devotee, offer obeisances, and worship Him, assuring that by being absorbed in Him, Arjuna will reach Him.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः। यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: Listen again, O mighty-armed Arjuna. Because you are My dear friend, for your benefit I shall speak to you further, giving you knowledge that is better than what I have already explained.
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca bhūya eva mahā-bāho śṛṇu me paramaṁ vacaḥ yat te 'haṁ prīyamāṇāya vakṣyāmi hita-kāmyayā
verses.meaning: Krishna begins speaking again, emphasizing His special affection for Arjuna and His desire to further his understanding.

verses.sanskrit: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः। अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः॥
verses.translation: Neither the hosts of demigods nor the great sages know My origin, for, in every respect, I am the source of the demigods and sages.
verses.transliteration: na me viduḥ sura-gaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣayaḥ aham ādir hi devānāṁ maharṣīṇāṁ ca sarvaśaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna reveals that even the demigods and great sages do not fully comprehend His origin, as He is their source.

verses.sanskrit: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम्। असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते॥
verses.translation: He who knows Me as the unborn, beginningless, the Supreme Lord of all the worlds—he, undeluded among men, is freed from all sins.
verses.transliteration: yo mām ajam anādiṁ ca vetti loka-maheśvaram asammūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣu sarva-pāpaiḥ pramucyate
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the knowledge that leads to liberation: understanding Him as unborn, beginningless, and the Supreme Lord.

verses.sanskrit: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः। सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च॥
verses.translation: Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from doubt and delusion, forgiveness, truthfulness, control of the senses, control of the mind, happiness and distress, birth, death, fearlessness, and also fear,
verses.transliteration: buddhir jñānam asammohaḥ kṣamā satyaṁ damaḥ śamaḥ sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo 'bhāvo bhayaṁ cābhayam eva ca
verses.meaning: Krishna lists various qualities and states of being, including intelligence, knowledge, and dualities like happiness and distress.

verses.sanskrit: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः। भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः॥
verses.translation: Nonviolence, equanimity, satisfaction, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy—these various qualities of living beings are created by Me alone.
verses.transliteration: ahiṁsā samatā tuṣṭis tapo dānaṁ yaśo 'yaśaḥ bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṁ matta eva pṛthag-vidhāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna declares that all these diverse qualities in living beings originate from Him.

verses.sanskrit: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा। मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः॥
verses.translation: The seven great sages and before them the four others [Sanaka, Sananda, Sanātana and Sanatkumāra] and the Manus come from Me, born from My mind, and all the living beings populating the various planets descend from them.
verses.transliteration: maharṣayaḥ sapta pūrve catvāro manavas tathā mad-bhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣāṁ loka imāḥ prajāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that great sages, the Manus, and all living beings originate from His mind.

verses.sanskrit: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः। सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः॥
verses.translation: One who truly knows this opulence and mystic power of Mine engages in unalloyed devotional service; of this there is no doubt.
verses.transliteration: etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ ca mama yo vetti tattvataḥ so 'vikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṁśayaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna states that understanding His opulence and mystic power leads to unwavering devotional service.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते। इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः॥
verses.translation: I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds. Everything emanates from Me. The wise who perfectly know this engage in My devotional service and worship Me with all their hearts.
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate iti matvā bhajante māṁ budhā bhāva-samanvitāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna declares Himself as the source of all worlds, prompting the wise to worship Him with devotion.

verses.sanskrit: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम्। कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च॥
verses.translation: The thoughts of My pure devotees dwell in Me, their lives are fully devoted to My service, and they derive great satisfaction and bliss always enlightening one another and conversing about Me.
verses.transliteration: mac-cittā mad-gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam kathayantaś ca māṁ nityaṁ tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the characteristics of His pure devotees: their minds are on Him, their lives are dedicated to His service, and they find joy in discussing Him.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम्। ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते॥
verses.translation: To those who are constantly devoted to serving Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.
verses.transliteration: teṣāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam dadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ taṁ yena mām upayānti te
verses.meaning: Krishna grants the understanding needed to reach Him to those who are always devoted to serving Him with love.

verses.sanskrit: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः। नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता॥
verses.translation: To show them special mercy, I, dwelling in their hearts, destroy with the shining lamp of knowledge the darkness born of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: teṣām evānukampārtham aham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥ nāśayāmy ātma-bhāva-stho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā
verses.meaning: Krishna, residing in their hearts, destroys the darkness of ignorance with the lamp of knowledge, showing them special mercy.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान्। पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम्॥
verses.translation: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the ultimate abode, the purest, the Absolute Truth. You are the eternal, transcendental Person, the origin of all, unborn, and all-pervading.
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca paraṁ brahma paraṁ dhāma pavitraṁ paramaṁ bhavān puruṣaṁ śāśvataṁ divyam ādi-devam ajaṁ vibhum
verses.meaning: Arjuna acknowledges Krishna as the Supreme Brahman, the ultimate abode, and the origin of everything.

verses.sanskrit: आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा। असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे॥
verses.translation: All the great sages such as Nārada, Asita, Devala and Vyāsa confirm this truth about You, and now You Yourself are declaring it to me.
verses.transliteration: āhus tvām ṛṣayaḥ sarve devarṣir nāradas tathā asito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṁ caiva bravīṣi me
verses.meaning: Arjuna mentions that great sages like Narada, Asita, Devala, and Vyasa have confirmed Krishna's supreme nature, which Krishna Himself is now declaring.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव। ते भगवन् रूपं पश्यमि विस्तुतम्॥
verses.translation: O Krishna, I totally accept as truth all that You have told me. Now please reveal to me Your universal form.
verses.transliteration: sarvam etad ṛtaṁ manye yan māṁ vadasi keśava yad dhruvaṁ te bhagavan rūpaṁ paśyami viśva-rūpam
verses.meaning: Arjuna expresses his complete acceptance of Krishna's words and requests to see His universal form.

verses.sanskrit: भगवन्कृपया भूयः श्रोतुमिच्छामि ते मुखात्। तत्त्वस्वरूपयोगं ते अविस्तरेण जनार्दन॥
verses.translation: O Supreme Lord, I wish to understand how You pervade this material creation. Please describe those opulences to me.
verses.transliteration: bhagavan kṛpayā bhūyaḥ śrotum icchāmi te mukhāt yat tat svabhāva-saṁsthitasya kīrtir ya iha śreyasī
verses.meaning: Arjuna expresses his desire to hear in detail about Krishna's divine glories and how He pervades the creation.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः। प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: Yes, I will tell you of My splendorous manifestations, but only of those which are prominent, O Arjuna, for My opulence is limitless.
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca hanta te kathayiṣyāmi divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ prādhānyataḥ kuru-śreṣṭha nāsty anto vistarasya me
verses.meaning: Krishna agrees to describe His principal divine glories, acknowledging that His full opulence is limitless.

verses.sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः। अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च॥
verses.translation: O Arjuna, I am the Self seated in the hearts of all living entities. I am the beginning, the middle and the end of all beings.
verses.transliteration: aham ātmā guḍākeśa sarva-bhūtāśaya-sthitaḥ aham ādiś ca madhyaṁ ca bhūtānām anta eva ca
verses.meaning: Krishna reveals that He is the Self within all beings and the origin, middle, and end of all existence.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान्। मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी॥
verses.translation: Of the Ādityas I am Viṣṇu, of lights I am the radiant sun, of the Maruts I am Marīci, and among the stars I am the moon.
verses.transliteration: ādityānām ahaṁ viṣṇur jyotiṣāṁ ravir aṁśumān marīcir marutām asmi nakṣatrāṇām ahaṁ śaśī
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself with prominent entities: Vishnu among the Adityas, the sun among lights, Marichi among the Maruts, and the moon among the stars.

verses.sanskrit: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः। इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना॥
verses.translation: Of the Vedas I am the Sāma-veda; of the demigods I am Indra, the king of heaven; of the senses I am the mind; and in living beings I am the living force [consciousness].
verses.transliteration: vedānāṁ sāma-vedo 'smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥ indriyāṇāṁ manaś cāsmi bhūtānām asmi cetanā
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the Sama Veda, Indra, the mind, and consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम्। वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम्॥
verses.translation: Of all the Rudras I am Lord Śiva; of the Yakṣas and Rākṣasas I am the Lord of wealth [Kuvera]; of the Vasus I am fire [Agni]; and of mountains I am Meru.
verses.transliteration: rudrāṇāṁ śaṅkaraś cāsmi vitteśo yakṣa-rakṣasām vasūnāṁ pāvakaś cāsmi meruḥ śikhariṇām aham
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as Shiva, Kuvera, Agni, and Meru.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम्। सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः॥
verses.translation: Of priests know Me to be the chief, Bṛhaspati. Of generals I am Kārttikeya, and of bodies of water I am the ocean.
verses.transliteration: purodhasāṁ ca mukhyaṁ māṁ viddhi pārtha bṛhaspatim senānīnām ahaṁ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as Brihaspati, Kartikeya, and the ocean.

verses.sanskrit: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम्। यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः॥
verses.translation: Of all the sages I am Bhṛgu; of speech I am the transcendental omkāra; of sacrifices I am the chanting of the holy names [japa]; and of immovable things I am the Himālayas.
verses.transliteration: maharṣīṇāṁ bhṛgur ahaṁ girām asmy ekam akṣaram yajñānāṁ japa-yajño 'smi sthāvarāṇāṁ himālayaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as Bhrigu, the syllable Om, the chanting of holy names (japa), and the Himalayas.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः। गन्धर्वाणाम् चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः॥
verses.translation: Of all trees I am the banyan tree, and of the sages among the demigods I am Nārada. Of the Gandharvas I am Citraratha, and among perfected beings I am Kapila.
verses.transliteration: aśvatthaḥ sarva-vṛkṣāṇāṁ devarṣīṇāṁ ca nāradaḥ gandharvāṇāṁ citrarathaḥ siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the banyan tree, Narada, Citraratha, and Kapila.

verses.sanskrit: उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम्। ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम्॥
verses.translation: Of horses know Me to be Uccaiḥśravā, produced from nectar; of lordly elephants I am Airāvata, and among men I am the monarch.
verses.transliteration: uccaiḥśravasam aśvānāṁ viddhi mām amṛtodbhavam airāvataṁ gajendrāṇāṁ narāṇāṁ ca narādhipam
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as Uccaihsrava, Airavata, and the monarch.

verses.sanskrit: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक्। प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पो सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः॥
verses.translation: Of weapons I am the thunderbolt; among cows I am the surabhi. Of causes for procreation I am Kandarpa, the god of love; and of serpents I am Vāsuki.
verses.transliteration: āyudhānām ahaṁ vajraṁ dhenūnām asmi kāma-dhuk prajanaś cāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the thunderbolt, Surabhi, Kandarpa, and Vasuki.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम्। पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम्॥
verses.translation: Of the Nāgas I am Ananta; of the aquatic deities I am Varuṇa. Of the departed ancestors I am Aryamā, and among the dispensers of law I am Yama.
verses.transliteration: anantaś cāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādasām aham pitṝṇām aryamā cāsmi yamaḥ saṁyamatām aham
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as Ananta, Varuna, Aryama, and Yama.

verses.sanskrit: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम्। मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम्॥
verses.translation: Among the Daityas I am Prahlāda, among subduers I am time, among beasts I am the lion, and among birds I am Garuḍa.
verses.transliteration: prahlādaś cāsmi daityānāṁ kālaḥ kalayatām aham mṛgānāṁ ca mṛgendro 'haṁ vainateyaś ca pakṣiṇām
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as Prahlada, time, the lion, and Garuda.

verses.sanskrit: पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम्। झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी॥
verses.translation: Of purifiers I am the wind, of the wielders of weapons I am Rāma, of fishes I am the shark, and of flowing rivers I am the Ganges.
verses.transliteration: pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śastra-bhṛtām aham jhaṣāṇāṁ makaraś cāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the wind, Rama, the shark, and the Ganges.

verses.sanskrit: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन। अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम्॥
verses.translation: Of all creations I am the beginning and the end and also the middle, O Arjuna. Of all sciences I am the spiritual science of the self, and among logicians I am the conclusive truth.
verses.transliteration: sargāṇām ādir antaś ca madhyaṁ caivāham arjuna adhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the beginning, middle, and end of all creations, the science of the self, and the conclusive truth in logic.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च। अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः॥
verses.translation: Of letters I am the letter A, and among compound words I am the dual compound. I am also inexhaustible time, and of all that is created I am the creator whose face is turned everywhere.
verses.transliteration: akṣarāṇām a-kāro 'smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya ca aham evākṣayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṁ viśvato-mukhaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the letter 'A', the dual compound, endless time, and the creator facing all directions.

verses.sanskrit: मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम्। कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा॥
verses.translation: I am all-devouring death, and I am the generating principle of all that is yet to be. Among women I am fame, fortune, fine speech, memory, intelligence, firmness and patience.
verses.transliteration: mṛtyuḥ sarva-haraś cāham udbhavaś ca bhaviṣyatām kīrtiḥ śrīr vāk ca nārīṇāṁ smṛtir medhā dhṛtiḥ kṣamā
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as all-devouring death, the generating principle, and qualities in women: fame, fortune, speech, memory, intelligence, firmness, and patience.

verses.sanskrit: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम्। मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः॥
verses.translation: Of the hymns in the Sāma-veda I am the Bṛhat-sāma; of poetry I am the Gāyatrī. Of months I am Mārgaśīrṣa [November-December], and of seasons I am spring.
verses.transliteration: bṛhat-sāma tathā sāmnāṁ gāyatrī chandasām aham māsānāṁ mārga-śīrṣo 'ham ṛtūnāṁ kusumākaraḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the Brihat-sama, the Gayatri, the month of Margashirsha, and the spring season.

verses.sanskrit: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्। जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्॥
verses.translation: I am the gambling of cheats, and the splendor of the splendid. I am victory, I am adventure, and I am the strength of the strong.
verses.transliteration: dyūtaṁ chalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham jayo 'smi vyavasāyo 'smi sattvaṁ sattva-vatām aham
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the gambling of cheats, the splendor of the splendid, victory, adventure, and the strength of the strong.

verses.sanskrit: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनंजयः। मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः॥
verses.translation: Of the descendants of Vṛṣṇi I am Vāsudeva, and of the Pāṇḍavas I am Arjuna. Of the sages I am Vyāsa, and among great thinkers I am Uśanā.
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṇīnāṁ vāsudevo 'smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥ munīnām apy ahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśanā kaviḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as Vasudeva, Arjuna, Vyasa, and Usana.

verses.sanskrit: सृष्टीनां आदिरहं अंतश्च मध्यं चैवाहम् अर्जुन। अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदताम् अहम्॥
verses.translation: Of all creations I am the beginning and the end and also the middle, O Arjuna. Of all sciences I am the spiritual science of the self, and among logicians I am the conclusive truth.
verses.transliteration: sṛṣṭīnām ādir ahaṁ antaś ca madhyaṁ caivāham arjuna adhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the beginning, middle, and end of all creations, the science of the self, and the conclusive truth in logic.

verses.sanskrit: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्। जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्॥
verses.translation: I am the gambling of cheats, and the splendor of the splendid. I am victory, I am adventure, and I am the strength of the strong.
verses.transliteration: dyūtaṁ chalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham jayo 'smi vyavasāyo 'smi sattvaṁ sattva-vatām aham
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as the gambling of cheats, the splendor of the splendid, victory, adventure, and the strength of the strong.

verses.sanskrit: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनंजयः। मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः॥
verses.translation: Of the descendants of Vṛṣṇi I am Vāsudeva, and of the Pāṇḍavas I am Arjuna. Of the sages I am Vyāsa, and among great thinkers I am Uśanā.
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṇīnāṁ vāsudevo 'smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥ munīnām apy ahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśanā kaviḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as Vāsudeva, Arjuna, Vyāsa, and Uśanā.

verses.sanskrit: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम्। मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम्॥
verses.translation: I am the punishment of wrongdoers, and I am the policy of those who desire victory. I am silence among secrets, and I am the wisdom of the wise.
verses.transliteration: daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣatām maunaṁ caivāsmi guhyānāṁ jñānaṁ jñānavatām aham
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies Himself as punishment, policy, silence, and wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन। न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्॥
verses.translation: Furthermore, O Arjuna, I am the generating seed of all existences. There is no being—moving or nonmoving—that can exist without Me.
verses.transliteration: yac cāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ bījaṁ tad aham arjuna na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṁ carācaram
verses.meaning: Krishna declares Himself as the generating seed of all beings, without whom nothing can exist.

verses.sanskrit: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप। एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया॥
verses.translation: O mighty conqueror of enemies, there is no end to My divine manifestations. What I have spoken to you is but a mere indication of My infinite opulence.
verses.transliteration: nānto 'sti mama divyānāṁ vibhūtīnāṁ paraṁ-tapa eṣa tūddeśataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā
verses.meaning: Krishna concludes by saying that His divine manifestations are endless and that what He has described is just a glimpse of His infinite opulence.

verses.sanskrit: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा। तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम्॥
verses.translation: Know that all opulent, beautiful, and glorious creations spring from but a spark of My splendor.
verses.transliteration: yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṁ śrīmad ūrjitam eva vā tat tad evāvagaccha tvaṁ mama tejo-'ṁśa-sambhavam
verses.meaning: Krishna states that all that is opulent, beautiful, and glorious is a manifestation of a fraction of His splendor.

verses.sanskrit: अथ वा किं बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन। विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत्॥
verses.translation: But what need is there, Arjuna, for all this detailed knowledge? With a single fragment of Myself, I pervade and support this entire universe.
verses.transliteration: atha vā kiṁ bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjuna viṣṭabhyāham idaṁ kṛtsnam ekāṁśena sthito jagat
verses.meaning: Krishna concludes by saying that there is no need for extensive knowledge, as He pervades and supports the entire universe with just a fraction of Himself.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसञ्ज्ञितम्। यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम॥
verses.translation: Arjuna said: By Your grace I have received the most confidential spiritual knowledge. My illusion is now dispelled.
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca mad-anugrahāya paramaṁ guhyam adhyātma-saṁjñitam yat tvayoktaṁ vacas tena moho 'yaṁ vigato mama
verses.meaning: Arjuna speaks, expressing gratitude for the knowledge Krishna has imparted, which has dispelled his illusion.

verses.sanskrit: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया। त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम्॥
verses.translation: O lotus-eyed one, I have heard from You in detail about the appearance and disappearance of every living creature and have realized Your inexhaustible glories.
verses.transliteration: bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṁ śrutau vistaraso mayā tvattaḥ kamala-patrākṣa māhātmyam api cāvyayam
verses.meaning: Arjuna acknowledges that he has heard in detail from Krishna about the origin and dissolution of beings and His infinite glories.

verses.sanskrit: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर। द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम॥
verses.translation: O Supreme Lord, though I understand You to be as You have described Yourself, I wish to see Your divine form, O Supreme Person.
verses.transliteration: evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṁ parameśvara draṣṭum icchāmi te rūpam aiśvaraṁ puruṣottama
verses.meaning: Arjuna, while understanding Krishna's nature, expresses his desire to see His divine, universal form.

verses.sanskrit: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुं प्रभो। योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम्॥
verses.translation: O my Lord, if You think that I am able to behold Your cosmic form, kindly reveal that unlimited self of Yours to me.
verses.transliteration: manyase yadi tac chakyaṁ mayā draṣṭuṁ prabho yogeśvara tato me tvaṁ darśayātmānam avyayam
verses.meaning: Arjuna asks Krishna, if He deems it possible, to reveal His eternal, cosmic form.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः। नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: My dear Arjuna, see now My opulence, hundreds of thousands of varied divine forms, multicolored, like the sea.
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ nānā-vidhāni divyāni nānā-varṇākṛtīni ca
verses.meaning: Krishna begins to reveal His universal form, describing it as having hundreds of thousands of varied, divine, and multicolored forms.

verses.sanskrit: पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा। बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत॥
verses.translation: O best of the Bhāratas, see here the Ādityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Aśvinī-kumāras and all the various demigods. Behold the many wonders no one has ever seen before.
verses.transliteration: paśyādityān vasūn rudrān aśvinau marutas tathā bahūny adṛṣṭa-pūrvāṇi paśyāścaryāṇi bhārata
verses.meaning: Krishna invites Arjuna to see various demigods and wonders never seen before.

verses.sanskrit: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम्। मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि॥
verses.translation: O Arjuna, whatever you wish to see, behold at once in this body of Mine! This universal form can show you whatever you now desire, as well as whatever you may want to see in the future. Everything—moving and nonmoving—is here completely in one place.
verses.transliteration: ihaika-sthaṁ jagat kṛtsnaṁ paśyādya sa-carācaram mama dehe guḍākeśa yac cānyad draṣṭum icchasi
verses.meaning: Krishna tells Arjuna that his universal form contains everything Arjuna wishes to see, including the entire universe and anything he may desire to see in the future.

verses.sanskrit: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा। दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्॥
verses.translation: But you cannot see Me with your present eyes. Therefore I give you divine eyes. Behold My mystic opulence!
verses.transliteration: na tu māṁ śakyase draṣṭum anenaiva sva-cakṣuṣā divyaṁ dadāmi te cakṣuḥ paśya me yogam aiśvaram
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that Arjuna cannot see His universal form with his ordinary eyes and grants him divine vision to do so.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच। एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः। दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्॥
verses.translation: Sañjaya said: O King, having spoken thus, the Supreme Lord of all mystic power, Hari, revealed to Arjuna His transcendental universal form.
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca evam uktvā tato rājan mahā-yogeśvaro hariḥ darśayāmāsa pārthāya paramaṁ rūpam aiśvaram
verses.meaning: Sanjaya narrates to King Dhritarashtra that, after speaking these words, Hari, the Supreme Lord, revealed His divine universal form to Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम्। अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम्॥
verses.translation: Arjuna saw in that universal form unlimited mouths, unlimited eyes, unlimited wonderful visions. The form was decorated with many celestial ornaments and bore many divine weapons.
verses.transliteration: aneka-vaktra-nayanam anekādbhuta-darśanam aneka-divyābharaṇaṁ divyānekodyatāyudham
verses.meaning: Sanjaya describes Arjuna's vision of the universal form as having countless mouths, eyes, and wonders, adorned with divine ornaments and weapons.

verses.sanskrit: दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यानुलेपनान्वितम्। सर्वाश्चर्यमयमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम्॥
verses.translation: He was garlanded with celestial flowers and dressed in transcendental garments, with divine fragrances and many amazing wonders. In this way the infinite form of the Lord was expanding everywhere.
verses.transliteration: divya-mālyāmbara-dharaṁ divyānulepanānvitam sarvāścarya-mayam anantaṁ viśvato-mukham
verses.meaning: The universal form is further described as adorned with divine garlands and garments, celestial fragrances, and as being infinite and all-pervading.

verses.sanskrit: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता। यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्यात्तस्य भासः महात्मनः॥
