verses.sanskrit: आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः। यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम्॥
verses.translation: Self-complacent and always impudent, deluded by wealth and false pride, they sometimes perform sacrifices in name only, without following the rules and regulations.
verses.transliteration: ātma-sambhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhana-māna-madānvitāḥ yajante nāma-yajñais te dambhenāvidhi-pūrvakam
verses.meaning: Krishna further characterizes the demonic as self-conceited, stubborn, and deluded by wealth and pride, performing sacrifices nominally and improperly.

verses.sanskrit: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः। मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः॥
verses.translation: Bewildered by false ego, strength, pride, lust and anger, they become envious of Me, who is situated in their bodies and in the bodies of others, and scoff at the real religion.
verses.transliteration: ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ ca saṁśritāḥ mām ātma-para-deheṣu pradviṣanto 'bhyasūyakāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna notes that the demonic, driven by ego, strength, pride, lust, and anger, envy Him in all beings and reject true religion.

verses.sanskrit: तामहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान्। क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु॥
verses.translation: Those who are envious and mischievous, who are the lowest among men, I perpetually cast into the ocean of material existence, into various demoniac species of life.
verses.transliteration: tān ahaṁ dviṣataḥ krūrān saṁsāreṣu narādhamān kṣipāmy ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣv eva yoniṣu
verses.meaning: Krishna reveals that He condemns the envious and mischievous to repeated births in demonic species within the material world.

verses.sanskrit: आपन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि। मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम्॥
verses.translation: Attaining repeated birth amongst the demons, such persons never approach Me. They gradually sink down to the most abominable condition of existence.
verses.transliteration: āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṁ gatim
verses.meaning: Krishna reiterates that the deluded, continually reborn among demons, never reach Him and descend to the lowest state of existence.

verses.sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः। कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत्॥
verses.translation: There are three gates leading down to this hell—lust, anger and greed. Every sane man should give these up, for they lead to the degradation of the soul.
verses.transliteration: tri-vidhaṁ naraka-syedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśanam ātmanaḥ kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies the three gates to hell as lust, anger, and greed, and advises every sane person to abandon them for the sake of their soul's upliftment.

verses.sanskrit: एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः। आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम्॥
verses.translation: The man who is freed from these three gates of darkness, O son of Kuntī, performs acts conducive to self-realization and thus gradually attains the supreme destination.
verses.transliteration: etair vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamo-dvārais tribhir naraḥ ācaraty ātmanaḥ śreyas tato yāti parāṁ gatim
verses.meaning: Krishna contrasts this, stating that those who free themselves from these three gates of darkness engage in self-realizing activities and attain the supreme destination.

verses.sanskrit: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः। न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम्॥
verses.translation: He who discards scriptural injunctions and acts according to his own whims attains neither perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme destination.
verses.transliteration: yaḥ śāstra-vidhim utsṛjya vartate kāma-kārataḥ na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṁ na parāṁ gatim
verses.meaning: Krishna warns against disregarding scriptural injunctions, stating that acting whimsically leads to failure in achieving perfection, happiness, and the supreme goal.

verses.sanskrit: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ। ज्ञातुं शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि॥
verses.translation: Therefore in determining what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, the scriptures should be your authority. Having understood the injunctions of the scriptures, you should act accordingly.
verses.transliteration: tasmāc chāstraṁ pramāṇaṁ te kāryākārya-vyavasthitau jñātuṁ śāstra-vidhānoktaṁ karma kartum ihārhasi
verses.meaning: Krishna concludes by emphasizing the importance of scriptures as the authority in determining right and wrong actions, and advises acting in accordance with their injunctions.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः। तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः॥
verses.translation: Arjuna inquired: O Kṛṣṇa, what is the situation of those who do not follow the principles of scripture but worship according to their own imagination? Are they in goodness, in passion or in ignorance?
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca ye śāstra-vidhim utsṛjya yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ teṣāṁ niṣṭhā tu kā kṛṣṇa sattvam āho rajas tamaḥ
verses.meaning: Arjuna asks about the faith of those who neglect scriptural rules and worship according to their own imagination. He inquires whether their faith is in goodness, passion, or ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा। सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: According to the modes of nature acquired by the embodied living beings, this faith can be of three kinds—in goodness, in passion or in ignorance. Now hear about these.
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca tri-vidhā bhavati śraddhā dehināṁ sā svabhāva-jā sāttvikī rājasī caiva tāmasī ceti tāṁ śṛṇu
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that faith, inherent in embodied beings, is of three types, corresponding to the modes of nature: goodness, passion, and ignorance. He advises Arjuna to listen about them.

verses.sanskrit: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत। श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः॥
verses.translation: O son of Bharata, according to one’s existence under the various modes of nature, one evolves a particular type of faith. The living being is said to be of a particular faith according to the modes he has acquired.
verses.transliteration: sattvānurūpā sarvasya śraddhā bhavati bhārata śraddhā-mayo 'yaṁ puruṣo yo yac-chraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna says that faith is shaped by one's association with the modes of nature, and a person's faith determines their character.

verses.sanskrit: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षराक्षसरक्षसान्। प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तमसा जनाः॥
verses.translation: Men in the mode of goodness worship the demigods; those in the mode of passion worship the great demons; and those in the mode of ignorance worship ghosts and spirits.
verses.transliteration: yajante sāttvikā devān yakṣa-rakṣaḥ-piśācān bhūta-gaṇāṁś cānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes that people in goodness worship demigods, those in passion worship demons, and those in ignorance worship ghosts and spirits.

verses.sanskrit: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः। दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः॥
verses.translation: Those who undergo severe austerities and penances not in accordance with the rules and regulations of the scriptures, who perform them out of pride and selfishness, who are impelled by lust and attachment,
verses.transliteration: aśāstra-vihitaṁ ghoraṁ tapyante ye tapo janāḥ dambhāhaṅkāra-saṁyuktāḥ kāma-rāga-balānvitāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes those who perform severe, unscriptural austerities with pride, selfishness, lust, and attachment.

verses.sanskrit: कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः। मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान्॥
verses.translation: and who torture the bodily organs, the Supersoul dwelling within, and themselves at the same time—you should know these men to be demons.
verses.transliteration: karṣayantaḥ śarīra-sthaṁ bhūta-grāmam acetasaḥ māṁ caivāntaḥ-śarīra-sthaṁ tān viddhy āsura-niścayān
verses.meaning: Krishna concludes that those who torture their bodies, the Supersoul within, and themselves are of demonic resolve.

verses.sanskrit: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः। यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु॥
verses.translation: Even the food they like is of three kinds, like the sacrifice, austerity and charity they perform. Now hear of the distinctions between them.
verses.transliteration: āhāras tv api sarvasya tri-vidho bhavati priyaḥ yajñas tapas tathā dānaṁ teṣāṁ bhedam imaṁ śṛṇu
verses.meaning: Krishna states that food, sacrifice, austerity, and charity are also of three kinds, and He will explain their distinctions.

verses.sanskrit: आयुः सत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः। रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः॥
verses.translation: Foods that increase the duration of life, purify one’s existence, give strength, health, happiness and satisfaction are dear to those in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: āyuḥ-sattva-balārogya-sukha-prīti-vivardhanāḥ rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛdyā āhārāḥ sāttvika-priyāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes foods favored by those in goodness: those that promote longevity, purity, strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction; they are juicy, oily, nourishing, and pleasing.

verses.sanskrit: कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः। आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः॥
verses.translation: Foods that are too bitter, too sour, salty, hot, pungent, dry and burning are dear to those in the mode of passion. Such foods cause distress, misery and disease.
verses.transliteration: kaṭv-amla-lavaṇāty-uṣṇa-tīkṣṇa-rūkṣa-vidāhinaḥ āhārā rājasasyeṣṭā duḥkha-śokāmaya-pradāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes foods favored by those in passion: those that are too bitter, sour, salty, hot, pungent, dry, and burning, which cause distress, misery, and disease.

verses.sanskrit: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत्। उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम्॥
verses.translation: Food prepared more than three hours before being eaten, food that is tasteless, decomposed and putrid, and food consisting of remnants and untouchable things is dear to those in the mode of darkness.
verses.transliteration: yāta-yāmaṁ gata-rasaṁ pūti paryuṣitaṁ ca yat ucchiṣṭam api cāmedhyaṁ bhojanaṁ tāmasa-priyam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes the food liked by those in the mode of ignorance: stale, tasteless, putrid, and unclean.

verses.sanskrit: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदिष्टो य इज्यते। यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः॥
verses.translation: Of sacrifices, the sacrifice performed according to the direction of scripture, with no desire for gain, and with the mind fixed on the sacrifice itself, is said to be in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: aphalākāṅkṣibhir yajño vidhi-diṣṭo ya ijyate yaṣṭavyam eveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna defines a sacrifice in the mode of goodness: performed according to scripture, without desire for fruit, and with a focused mind.

verses.sanskrit: अभिसन्धाय तु फलमर्थं च अपि इच्छता। दम्भेन च अपि यत् इज्यते तत् यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम्॥
verses.translation: But the sacrifice that is performed for some material benefit, or for pride, know that to be in the mode of passion, O best of the Bharatas.
verses.transliteration: abhisandhāya tu phalam arthaṁ ca api icchatā dambhena ca api yat ijyate taṁ yajñaṁ viddhi rājasam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes a sacrifice in the mode of passion: performed for material gain or with pride.

verses.sanskrit: विधिहीनं असृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनं अदक्षिणम्। श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते॥
verses.translation: Any sacrifice performed without regard for scriptural injunctions, with no distribution of food, without chanting of Vedic hymns, without payment to the priests, and without faith is considered to be in the mode of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: vidhi-hīnam asṛṣṭānnaṁ mantra-hīnam adakṣiṇam aśraddhā-virahitaṁ yajñaṁ tāmasaṁ paricakṣate
verses.meaning: Krishna characterizes a sacrifice in the mode of ignorance: performed without following rules, without offering food, without mantras, without donations, and without faith.

verses.sanskrit: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम्। ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते॥
verses.translation: Worship of the Supreme Lord, the brāhmaṇas, the spiritual master, and superiors; cleanliness; simplicity; celibacy; and nonviolence are called the austerity of the body.
verses.transliteration: deva-dvija-guru-prājña-pūjanaṁ śaucam ārjavam brahmacaryam ahiṁsā ca śārīraṁ tapa ucyate
verses.meaning: Krishna defines bodily austerity: worship of God, the wise, teachers, and elders; cleanliness, simplicity, celibacy, and nonviolence.

verses.sanskrit: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत्। स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते॥
verses.translation: Speaking words that are truthful, pleasing, beneficial, and not agitating to others, and regularly studying the Vedic literature, is called the austerity of speech.
verses.transliteration: anudvega-karaṁ vākyaṁ satyaṁ priya-hitaṁ ca yat svādhyāyābhyasanaṁ caiva vāṅ-mayaṁ tapa ucyate
verses.meaning: Krishna defines the austerity of speech: speaking truthfully, pleasantly, beneficially, and non-agitatingly; and studying Vedic literature.

verses.sanskrit: मनः प्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः। भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते॥
verses.translation: And satisfaction, simplicity, seriousness, self-control and purity of existence are called the austerity of the mind.
verses.transliteration: manaḥ-prasādaḥ saumyatvaṁ maunam ātma-vinigrahaḥ bhāva-saṁśuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam ucyate
verses.meaning: Krishna defines mental austerity: satisfaction, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of purpose.

verses.sanskrit: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत् त्रिविधं नरैः। अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर् युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते॥
verses.translation: This threefold austerity, performed with transcendental faith by men of determination, who do not desire material benefits but work only for the sake of the Supreme, is called austerity in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: śraddhayā parayā taptaṁ tapas tat tri-vidhaṁ naraiḥ aphalākāṅkṣibhir yuktaiḥ sāttvikaṁ paricakṣate
verses.meaning: Krishna describes austerity in goodness: performed with faith, determination, without seeking material reward, and for the sake of the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत्। क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम्॥
verses.translation: That austerity which is performed for the sake of gaining respect, honor and worship and which is done with ostentation is said to be in the mode of passion. It is neither stable nor permanent.
verses.transliteration: satkāra-māna-pūjārthaṁ tapo dambhena caiva yat kriyate tad iha proktaṁ rājasaṁ calam adhruvam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes austerity in passion: performed for respect, honor, and worship, and with pretense; unstable and temporary.

verses.sanskrit: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः। परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्॥
verses.translation: Austerity that is performed out of foolishness, with self-torture or to destroy or injure others, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: mūḍha-grāheṇātmano yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ parasyotsādanārthaṁ vā tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes austerity in ignorance: performed foolishly, involving self-torture or intended to harm others.

verses.sanskrit: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे। देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम्॥
verses.translation: That charity which is given out of duty, without expectation of return, at the proper time and place, and to a worthy person is considered to be in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: dātavyam iti yad dānaṁ dīyate 'nupakāriṇe deśe kāle ca pātre ca tad dānaṁ sāttvikaṁ smṛtam
verses.meaning: Krishna defines charity in the mode of goodness: given as a duty, without expectation of return, at the right time and place, and to a worthy recipient.

verses.sanskrit: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः। दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम्॥
verses.translation: But charity performed with the expectation of some return, or for the sake of fruitive results, or in a grudging mood, is said to be in the mode of passion.
verses.transliteration: yat tu pratyupakārārthaṁ phalam uddiśya vā punaḥ dīyate ca parikliṣṭaṁ tad dānaṁ rājasaṁ smṛtam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes charity in the mode of passion: given with expectation of return, for personal gain, or reluctantly.

verses.sanskrit: अदेशकाले यद्दानम् अपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते। असत्कृतम् अवज्ञातं तत् तामसम् उदाहृतम्॥
verses.translation: And charity performed at an improper place and time and given to unworthy persons, or given without respect or with contempt, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: adeśa-kāle yad dānam apātrebhyaś ca dīyate asatkṛtam avajñātaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes charity in the mode of ignorance: given at the wrong time and place, to unworthy persons, or without respect.

verses.sanskrit: ॐ तत् सत् इति निर्देशः ब्रह्मणः त्रिविधः स्मृतः। ब्राह्मणाः तेन वेदाः च यज्ञाः च विहिताः पुरा॥
verses.translation: From the beginning of creation, the three words om tat sat have been used to indicate the Supreme Absolute Truth. These three words were uttered by brāhmaṇas as they chanted the hymns of the Vedas and performed sacrifices for the satisfaction of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
verses.transliteration: oṁ tat sad iti nirdeśaḥ brahmaṇaḥ tri-vidhaḥ smṛtaḥ brāhmaṇās tena vedāś ca yajñāś ca vihitāḥ purā
verses.meaning: Krishna explains the significance of 'Om Tat Sat' as indicators of the Supreme Absolute Truth, used by Brahmanas in Vedic chants and sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात् ओम् इति उद्धृत्य यज्ञ दान तपः क्रियाः। प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततम् ब्रह्मवादिनाम्॥
verses.translation: Therefore, transcendentalists begin every rite of sacrifice, charity and penance with om to indicate the Supreme Absolute Truth.
verses.transliteration: tasmād om ity udāhṛtya yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṁ brahma-vādinām
verses.meaning: Krishna says that transcendentalists begin all sacrificial rites, charity, and penance by uttering 'Om' to invoke the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: तत् इति अनभिसन्धाय फलम् यज्ञ तपः क्रियाः। दान क्रियाः च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्ष काङ्क्षिभिः॥
verses.translation: The word tat is uttered by those intent on liberation when performing sacrifices, penances and charities, without seeking material gain.
verses.transliteration: tad ity anabhisandhāya phalam yajña-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ dāna-kriyāś ca vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣa-kāṅkṣibhiḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that those seeking liberation utter 'Tat' when performing these acts, without desiring material rewards.

verses.sanskrit: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सत् इति एतत् प्रयुज्यते। प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सत् शब्दः पार्थ युज्यते॥
verses.translation: The Absolute Truth is the target of devotional sacrifice, and it is indicated by the word sat. The performer of such sacrifice is also called sat, as is all purposeful work which is done to please the Supreme Person, O son of Pṛthā.
verses.transliteration: sad-bhāve sādhu-bhāve ca sad ity etat prayujyate praśaste karmaṇi tathā sat-śabdaḥ pārtha yujyate
verses.meaning: Krishna reveals that 'Sat' signifies the Absolute Truth, a devotee, and any work done to please the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत्। असत् इति उच्यते पार्थ न च तत् प्रेत्य नो इह॥
verses.translation: O son of Pṛthā, any sacrifice performed without faith, or any charity given without faith, any penance undertaken without faith, whatever action is done without faith—all that is nonpermanent. It is called asat.
verses.transliteration: aśraddhayā hutaṁ dattaṁ tapas taptaṁ kṛtaṁ ca yat asad ity ucyate pārtha na ca tat pretya no iha
verses.meaning: Krishna concludes by stating that any sacrifice, charity, or austerity performed without faith is impermanent and called 'Asat.'

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। सन्न्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम्। त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन॥
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O mighty-armed one, I wish to understand the purpose of renunciation [tyāga] and of the renounced order of life [sannyāsa], O Hṛṣīkeśa, master of the senses.
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca sannyāsasya mahā-bāho tattvam icchāmi veditum tyāgasya ca hṛṣīkeśa pṛthak keśi-niṣūdana
verses.meaning: Arjuna inquires about the true meaning of sannyasa (renounced life) and tyaga (renunciation).

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। काम्यानां कर्मणा न्यासं सन्न्यासं कवयो विदुः। सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: The giving up of activities that are based on desire is what the wise call the renounced order of life [sannyāsa]. And giving up the results of all activities is what the experienced call renunciation [tyāga].
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca kāmyānāṁ karmaṇāṁ nyāsaṁ sannyāsaṁ kavayo viduḥ sarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ prāhus tyāgaṁ vicakṣaṇāḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna explains sannyasa as renouncing desire-driven actions, and tyaga as renouncing the fruits of all actions.

verses.sanskrit: त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः। यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे॥
verses.translation: Some learned men declare that all kinds of fruitive activities should be given up, while others say that acts of sacrifice, charity and penance should never be abandoned.
verses.transliteration: tyājyaṁ doṣavad ity eke karma prāhur manīṣiṇaḥ yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyam iti cāpare
verses.meaning: Krishna mentions the differing views on whether actions should be renounced, or if acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance should continue.

verses.sanskrit: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्याग विषये। त्रिविधः पुरुषव्याघ्र त्यागः प्रकीर्तितः॥
verses.translation: O best of the Bhāratas, hear My judgment about renunciation. O tiger among men, there are three kinds of renunciation [tyāga] according to the modes of nature.
verses.transliteration: niścayaṁ śṛṇu me tatra tyāge puruṣa-vyāghra tri-vidhaḥ puruṣa-vyāghra tyāgaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna asks Arjuna to hear His judgment on tyaga (renunciation), classifying it into three types according to the modes of nature.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत्। यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम्॥
verses.translation: Acts of sacrifice, charity and penance are not to be given up; they must be performed. Indeed, sacrifice, charity and penance purify even the great souls.
verses.transliteration: yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-karma na tyājyaṁ kāryam eva tat yajño dānaṁ tapaś caiva pāvanāni manīṣiṇām
verses.meaning: Krishna asserts that sacrifice, charity, and penance should not be abandoned, as they purify even the great souls.

verses.sanskrit: एतानि अपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च। कर्तव्यानि इति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतम् उत्तमम्॥
verses.translation: O son of Pṛthā, all these activities should be performed without attachment or any expectation of result. They should be performed as a matter of duty. That is My final opinion.
verses.transliteration: etāny api tu karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalāni ca kartavyānīti me pārtha niścitaṁ matam uttamam
verses.meaning: Krishna advises performing these actions without attachment or desire for results, seeing them as duties.

verses.sanskrit: नियतस्य तु सन्न्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते। मोहात् तस्य परित्यागः तामसः परिकीर्तितः॥
verses.translation: Prescribed duties should never be renounced. If one gives them up out of delusion, such renunciation is said to be in the mode of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: niyatasya tu sannyāsaḥ karmaṇo nopapadyate mohāt tasya parityāgaḥ tāmasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna states that renouncing obligatory duties due to delusion is renunciation in the mode of ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: दुःखम् इति एव यत् कर्म कायक्लेश भयात् त्यजेत्। स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव फलम् आप्नोति॥
verses.translation: Anyone who gives up his prescribed duties as troublesome or because of the fear of bodily discomfort is said to have renounced in the mode of passion. Such action never leads to the elevation of renunciation.
verses.transliteration: duḥkham ity eva yat karma kāya-kleśa-bhayāt tyajet sa kṛtvā rājasaṁ tyāgaṁ naiva phalam āpnoti
verses.meaning: Krishna defines renouncing one's duties due to discomfort or fear as renunciation in the mode of passion, which does not lead to true renunciation.

verses.sanskrit: कार्यम् इति एव यत् कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन। सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलम् चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विकः मतः॥
verses.translation: O Arjuna, when one performs his prescribed duty only because it ought to be done, and renounces all attachment to the fruit, his renunciation is called renunciation in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: kāryam ity eva yat karma niyataṁ kriyate 'rjuna saṅgaṁ tyaktvā phalaṁ caiva sa tyāgaḥ sāttvikaḥ mataḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes renunciation in the mode of goodness: performing obligatory duties without attachment to the results, seeing them as simply what ought to be done.

verses.sanskrit: न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते। त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः॥
verses.translation: The wise, who neither hate disagreeable work nor attach themselves to agreeable work, having overcome doubts, are situated in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: na dveṣṭy akuśalaṁ karma kuśale nānuṣajjate tyāgī sattva-samāviṣṭo medhāvī chinna-saṁśayaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes those in the mode of goodness: they neither hate unpleasant work nor are attached to pleasant work, and they have overcome doubts.

verses.sanskrit: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः। यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागी अभिधीयते॥
verses.translation: It is indeed impossible for an embodied being to give up all activities altogether. But he who renounces the fruits of action is called one who has truly renounced.
verses.transliteration: na hi deha-bhṛtā śakyaṁ tyaktuṁ karmāṇy aśeṣataḥ yas tu karma-phala-tyāgī sa tyāgī abhidhīyate
verses.meaning: Krishna acknowledges that embodied beings cannot completely cease all actions, but one who renounces the fruits of their actions is considered a true renunciant.

verses.sanskrit: अनिष्टम् इष्टम् मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम्। भवति अत्यगिनां प्रेत्य न तु सन्न्यासिनां क्वचित्॥
verses.translation: For one who is not in renunciation, the three kinds of results of action—desirable, undesirable and mixed—accrue after death. But those who are in the renounced order of life have no such result to suffer or enjoy.
verses.transliteration: aniṣṭam iṣṭaṁ miśraṁ ca tri-vidhaṁ karmaṇaḥ phalam bhavati atyāgināṁ pretya na tu sannyāsināṁ kvacit
verses.meaning: Krishna explains that those who have not renounced experience three types of results after death, while the renounced (sannyasis) do not.

verses.sanskrit: पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे। सर्वकर्मणां सिद्धये श्रुतं साङ्ख्ये कृतान्ते॥
verses.translation: O mighty-armed Arjuna, according to the Vedānta, there are five causes for the accomplishment of all action. Now learn about these from Me.
verses.transliteration: pañcaitāni mahā-bāho kāraṇāni nibodha me sarva-karmāṇāṁ siddhaye śrute sāṅkhye kṛtānte
verses.meaning: Krishna introduces the five causes for the accomplishment of all action, as explained in Vedanta.

verses.sanskrit: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम्। विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम्॥
verses.translation: These are the seat of action [the body], the performer, the senses, the endeavors, and ultimately the Supersoul. These are the five factors of action.
verses.transliteration: adhiṣṭhānaṁ tathā kartā karaṇaṁ ca pṛthag-vidham vividhāś ca pṛthak-ceṣṭā daivaṁ caivātra pañcamam
verses.meaning: Krishna lists the five factors of action: the seat of action, the performer, the senses, the endeavors, and the Supersoul.

verses.sanskrit: शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत् कर्म प्रारभते नरः। न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः॥
verses.translation: Every action, right or wrong, that a man performs by his mind, body or speech is caused by these five factors.
verses.transliteration: śarīra-vāṅ-manobhir yat karma prārabhate naraḥ nyāyyaṁ vā viparītaṁ vā pañcaite tasya hetavaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna clarifies that these five factors are responsible for every action, whether right or wrong, performed by an individual.

verses.sanskrit: तत्रैवं सति कर्तारम् आत्मानं केवलं तु यः। पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान् न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः॥
verses.translation: Therefore one who thinks himself the only doer, not considering the five factors, is certainly not very intelligent and cannot see things in their true perspective.
verses.transliteration: tatraivaṁ sati kartāram ātmānaṁ kevalaṁ tu yaḥ paśyaty akṛta-buddhitvān na sa paśyati durmatiḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna warns that one who considers himself the sole doer, ignoring these five factors, is unintelligent and lacks true understanding.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य नाऽहङ्कृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते। हत्वापि स इमाँल्लोकान् न हन्ति न निबध्यते॥
verses.translation: One who is not motivated by false ego, whose intelligence is unentangled, though he kills men in this world, is not the killer. Nor is he bound by his actions.
verses.transliteration: yasya nāhaṅkṛto bhāvo buddhir yasya na lipyate hatvāpi sa imāṁl lokān na hanti na nibadhyate
verses.meaning: Krishna describes a person free from ego, whose intelligence is not entangled; even if involved in killing, he is not bound by those actions.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना। करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसङ्ग्रहः॥
verses.translation: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower are the three factors that motivate action; the senses, the work and the doer are the three constituents of action.
verses.transliteration: jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ parijñātā tri-vidhā karma-codanā karaṇaṁ karma karteti tri-vidhaḥ karma-saṅgrahaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna identifies three aspects that motivate action (knowledge, object, knower) and three constituents of action (senses, work, doer).

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः प्रोच्यते गुणसङ्ख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि॥
verses.translation: According to the three different modes of material nature, there are three kinds of knowledge, action and performer. Now hear of these from Me.
verses.transliteration: jñānaṁ karma ca kartā ca tridhaiva guṇa-bhedataḥ procyate guṇa-saṅkhyāne yathāvac chṛṇu tāny api
verses.meaning: Krishna states that knowledge, action, and the performer are also of three kinds, according to the modes of nature.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावम् अव्ययम् ईक्षते। अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तत् ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम्॥
verses.translation: That knowledge by which one undivided spiritual nature is seen in all living entities, though they are divided into various forms, is called knowledge in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūteṣu yenāikaṁ bhāvam avyayam īkṣate avibhaktam vibhakteṣu tat jñānaṁ viddhi sāttvikam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes knowledge in the mode of goodness: seeing one undivided spiritual nature in all beings, despite their diverse forms.

verses.sanskrit: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान् पृथग्विधान्। वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तत् ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम्॥
verses.translation: That knowledge by which one sees that in every different body there is a different type of living entity is called knowledge in the mode of passion.
verses.transliteration: pṛthaktvena tu yaj jñānaṁ nānā-bhāvān pṛthag-vidhān vetti sarveṣu bhūteṣu tat jñānaṁ viddhi rājasam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes knowledge in the mode of passion: seeing different living entities in each different body.

verses.sanskrit: यत् तु कृत्स्नवत् एकस्मिन् कार्ये सक्तम् अहैतुकम्। अतत्त्वार्थवत् अल्पं च तत् तामसम् उदाहृतम्॥
verses.translation: That knowledge by which one is attached to one kind of work as the all in all, without knowing the truth, and which is very meager, is said to be in the mode of darkness.
verses.transliteration: yat tu kṛtsnavad ekasmin kārye saktam ahaitukam atattvārthavad alpaṁ ca tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes knowledge in the mode of ignorance: being attached to one thing as all-encompassing, without understanding the truth, and which is very limited.

verses.sanskrit: नियतं असङ्गम् अरागद्वेषतः कृतम्। अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत् तत् सात्त्विकम् उच्यते॥
verses.translation: That action which is regulated, which is performed without attachment, without love or hatred, and which is done without thought of fruitive results is called action in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: niyataṁ asaṅgam arāga-dveṣataḥ kṛtam aphala-prepsunā karma yat tat sāttvikam ucyate
verses.meaning: Krishna describes action in the mode of goodness: regulated, performed without attachment, without love or hate, and without desire for results.

verses.sanskrit: यत् तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुनः। क्रियते बहुलायासं तत् कर्म राजसम् स्मृतम्॥
verses.translation: That action which is performed with great effort by one seeking to gratify his desires, and which is performed with a sense of false ego, is called action in the mode of passion.
verses.transliteration: yat tu kāmepsunā karma sāhaṅkāreṇa vā punaḥ kriyate bahulāyāsaṁ tat karma rājasam smṛtam
verses.meaning: Krishna describes action in the mode of passion: performed with great effort to fulfill desires and with ego.

verses.sanskrit: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसां अनपेक्ष्य च अपौरुषम्। मोहात् आरभ्यते कर्म यत् तत् तामसम् उच्यते॥
verses.translation: That action which is performed in ignorance and delusion without regard to future consequences or further bondage, and which is injurious and performed with violence, is said to be action in the mode of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: anubandhaṁ kṣayaṁ hiṁsām anapekṣya ca apauruṣam mohād ārabhyate karma yat tat tāmasam ucyate
verses.meaning: Krishna describes action in the mode of ignorance: performed in delusion, disregarding consequences, and involving harm or violence.

verses.sanskrit: मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः। सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते॥
verses.translation: One who performs his duty without association with the modes of material nature, who is freed from false ego, who acts with great determination and enthusiasm, and who is steady both in success and failure is called a worker in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: mukta-saṅgo 'nahaṁ-vādī dhṛty-utsāha-samanvitaḥ siddhy-asiddhyor nirvikāraḥ kartā sāttvika ucyate
verses.meaning: Krishna describes a doer in the mode of goodness: detached, free from ego, determined, enthusiastic, and equipoised in success and failure.

verses.sanskrit: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुः लुब्धो हिंसात्मकः अशुचिः। हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः॥
verses.translation: One who is attached to fruitive results, who is greedy, envious, and always impure, and who is moved by joy and sorrow, is said to be a worker in the mode of passion.
verses.transliteration: rāgī karma-phala-prepsuḥ lubdho hiṁsātmakaḥ aśuciḥ harṣa-śokānvitaḥ kartā rājasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna describes a doer in the mode of passion: attached to results, greedy, envious, impure, and affected by joy and sorrow.

verses.sanskrit: अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठः नैष्कृतिको अलसः। विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते॥
verses.translation: One who is unsteady, who cannot distinguish right from wrong, who is unenduring, cynical, and lazy, who is always morose, and who procrastinates is called a worker in the mode of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: ayuktaḥ prākṛtaḥ stabdhaḥ śaṭho naiṣkṛtiko 'lasaḥ viṣādī dīrgha-sūtrī ca kartā tāmasa ucyate
verses.meaning: Krishna describes a doer in the mode of ignorance: unsteady, unable to distinguish right from wrong, unenduring, cynical, lazy, morose, and procrastinating.

verses.sanskrit: बुद्धेः भेदं धृतेः च एव गुणतः त्रि विधं श्रुणु। प्रोच्यमानम् अशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनंजय॥
verses.translation: O conqueror of wealth, now please listen to My exposition of the three kinds of understanding and determination according to the three modes of material nature.
verses.transliteration: buddher bhedaṁ dhṛteś caiva guṇatas tri-vidhaṁ śṛṇu procyamānam aśeṣeṇa pṛthaktvena dhanañjaya
verses.meaning: Krishna asks Arjuna to listen to the further explanation of the three kinds of understanding and determination according to the modes of nature.

verses.sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्यं अकार्यं एव च। बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी॥
verses.translation: O son of Pṛthā, that understanding by which one knows what ought to be done and what ought not to be done, what is to be feared and what is not to be feared, what is binding and what is liberating, is understanding in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: pravṛttiṁ ca nivṛttiṁ ca kāryaṁ akāryaṁ eva ca bandhaṁ mokṣaṁ ca yā vetti buddhiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
verses.meaning: Krishna describes understanding in the mode of goodness: knowing what should and should not be done, what to fear and not fear, and what binds and liberates.

verses.sanskrit: यया धर्मम् अधर्मं च कार्यं च अकार्यं एव च। अयथावत् प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी॥
verses.translation: O son of Pṛthā, that understanding which enables one to distinguish between religion and irreligion, between what should be done and what should not be done, is called understanding in the mode of passion.
verses.transliteration: yayā dharmam adharmaṁ ca kāryaṁ cākāryaṁ eva ca ayathāvat prajānāti buddhiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
verses.meaning: Krishna describes understanding in the mode of passion: incorrectly distinguishing between religion and irreligion, and right and wrong actions.

verses.sanskrit: अधर्मं धर्मम् इति या मन्यते तमसाऽऽवृता। सर्वार्थान् विपरीतंश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी॥
verses.translation: That understanding which considers irreligion to be religion, and religion to be irreligion, under the spell of illusion and darkness, and which strives always in the wrong direction, O Pārtha, is understanding in the mode of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: adharmaṁ dharmam iti yā manyate tamasāvṛtā sarvārthān viparītāṁś ca buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
verses.meaning: Krishna describes understanding in the mode of ignorance: perceiving irreligion as religion, misunderstanding all things, and always striving in the wrong direction.

verses.sanskrit: धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः। योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी॥
verses.translation: O son of Pṛthā, that determination which is unbreakable, which is sustained with steadfastness by yoga practice, and which thus controls the activities of the mind, life, and senses, is determination in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: dhṛtyā yayā dhārayate manaḥ-prāṇendriya-kriyāḥ yogenāvyabhicāriṇyā dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
verses.meaning: Arjuna, steadfast determination sustained by yoga, controlling the mind, life, and senses, is in the mode of goodness.

verses.sanskrit: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान् धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन। प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा राजसी॥
verses.translation: But that determination by which one holds fast to fruitive results in religion, economic development, and sense gratification is in the mode of passion, O Arjuna.
verses.transliteration: yayā tu dharma-kāmārthān dhṛtyā dhārayate 'rjuna prasaṅgena phalākāṅkṣī dhṛtiḥ sā rājasī
verses.meaning: Arjuna, determination attached to fruitive results in religion, economic development, and sense gratification is in the mode of passion.

verses.sanskrit: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च। न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा तामसी॥
verses.translation: That determination which enables one to continue in sleep, laziness, illusion and depression is said to be in the mode of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: yayā svapnaṁ bhayaṁ śokaṁ viṣādaṁ madam eva ca na vimuñcati durmedhā dhṛtiḥ sā tāmasī
verses.meaning: Determination that leads to continuing in sleep, laziness, illusion, and depression is in the mode of ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ। अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति॥
verses.translation: O best of the Bhāratas, now please hear from Me about the three kinds of happiness by which the conditioned soul comes to enjoy, and by which he at times comes to the end of all distress.
verses.transliteration: sukhaṁ tv idānīṁ tri-vidhaṁ śṛṇu me bharatarṣabha abhyāsād ramate yatra duḥkhāntaṁ ca nigacchati
verses.meaning: Arjuna, hear about the three kinds of happiness that the conditioned soul enjoys and sometimes overcomes distress.

verses.sanskrit: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम्। तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम्॥
verses.translation: That which in the beginning may be just like poison but at the end is like the nectar of immortality—this kind of happiness is said to be in the mode of goodness.
verses.transliteration: yat tad agre viṣam iva pariṇāme 'mṛtopamam tat sukhaṁ sāttvikaṁ proktaṁ ātma-buddhi-prasāda-jam
verses.meaning: Happiness that initially seems like poison but ends like nectar, arising from self-realization, is in the mode of goodness.

verses.sanskrit: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम्। परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसम्॥
verses.translation: That happiness which is derived from the contact of the senses with their objects and which appears like nectar at first but at the end is like poison—such happiness is said to be in the mode of passion.
verses.transliteration: viṣayendriya-saṁyogād yat tad agre 'mṛtopamam pariṇāme viṣam iva tat sukhaṁ rājasam
verses.meaning: Happiness from the contact of senses with objects, initially like nectar but eventually like poison, is in the mode of passion.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चाग्रॆ चानुबन्धॆ च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः। निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्॥
verses.translation: And that happiness which is blind to self-realization, which is delusion from beginning to end, and which arises from sleep, laziness and illusion is said to be of the nature of ignorance.
verses.transliteration: yac cāgre cānubandhe ca sukhaṁ mohanam ātmanaḥ nidrālasya-pramādotthaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
verses.meaning: Happiness that deludes the self from beginning to end, arising from sleep, laziness, and illusion, is in the mode of ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः। सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात् त्रिभिर्गुणैः॥
verses.translation: There is no being existing, either here or among the demigods in the higher planetary systems, who is freed from these three modes of material nature.
verses.transliteration: na tad asti pṛthivyāṁ vā divi deveṣu vā punaḥ sattvaṁ prakṛti-jair muktaṁ yad ebhiḥ syāt tribhir guṇaiḥ
verses.meaning: No being, on Earth or in the higher planets, is free from the three modes of material nature.

verses.sanskrit: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप। कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः॥
verses.translation: Brāhmaṇas, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas and śūdras are distinguished by the qualities born of their own nature in accordance with the material modes, O subduer of the enemy.
verses.transliteration: brāhmaṇa-kṣatriya-viśāṁ śūdrāṇāṁ ca parantapa karmāṇi pravibhaktāni svabhāva-prabhavair guṇaiḥ
verses.meaning: The duties of brāhmaṇas, kṣatriyas, vaiśyas, and śūdras are determined by their inherent qualities and the modes of material nature.

verses.sanskrit: शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च। ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम्॥
verses.translation: Tranquility, self-control, austerity, purity, tolerance, honesty, wisdom, knowledge, and religiousness—these are the natural qualities of brāhmaṇas.
verses.transliteration: śamo damas tapaḥ śaucaṁ kṣāntir ārjavam eva ca jñānaṁ vijñānam āstikyaṁ brahma-karma svabhāva-jam
verses.meaning: Natural qualities of brāhmaṇas: tranquility, self-control, austerity, purity, tolerance, honesty, wisdom, knowledge, and religiousness.

verses.sanskrit: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम्। दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम्॥
verses.translation: Heroism, strength, determination, resourcefulness, courage in battle, generosity, and leadership are the natural qualities of kṣatriyas.
verses.transliteration: śauryaṁ tejo dhṛtir dākṣyaṁ yuddhe cāpy apalāyanam dānam īśvara-bhāvaś ca kṣātraṁ karma svabhāva-jam
verses.meaning: Natural qualities of kṣatriyas: heroism, strength, determination, resourcefulness, courage in battle, generosity, and leadership.

verses.sanskrit: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम्। परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम्॥
verses.translation: Farming, cow protection and commerce are the natural duties of the vaiśyas, and labor and service are the natural duties of the śūdras.
verses.transliteration: kṛṣi-go-rakṣya-vāṇijyaṁ vaiśya-karma svabhāva-jam paricaryātmakaṁ karma śūdrasyāpi svabhāva-jam
verses.meaning: Natural duties of vaiśyas: farming, cow protection, and commerce. Natural duty of śūdras: labor and service.

verses.sanskrit: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः। स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु॥
verses.translation: By following his natural duties, every man can become perfect. Now please hear from Me how this can be done.
verses.transliteration: sve sve karmaṇy abhirataḥ saṁsiddhiṁ labhate naraḥ sva-karma-nirataḥ siddhiṁ yathā vindati tac chṛṇu
verses.meaning: By fulfilling their natural duties, people can attain perfection. Krishna will explain how.

verses.sanskrit: यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम्। स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः॥
verses.translation: By worship of the Lord, who is the source of all beings and who pervades everything, a man can attain perfection through performance of his own work.
verses.transliteration: yataḥ pravṛttir bhūtānāṁ yena sarvam idaṁ tatam sva-karmaṇā tam abhyarcya siddhiṁ vindati mānavaḥ
verses.meaning: By worshiping the Lord through one's work, the source of all beings, perfection can be attained.

verses.sanskrit: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात्। स्वभाव नियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम्॥
verses.translation: It is better to engage in one’s own occupation, even though one may perform it imperfectly, than to accept another’s occupation and perform it perfectly. Duties prescribed according to one’s nature are never affected by sinful reactions.
verses.transliteration: śreyān sva-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt svanuṣṭhitāt svabhāva-niyataṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣam
verses.meaning: It is better to do one's own duty imperfectly than another's perfectly; one's natural duties do not incur sin.

verses.sanskrit: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत्। सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः॥
verses.translation: Every endeavor is covered by some fault, just as fire is covered by smoke. Therefore one should not give up the work born of his nature, O son of Kuntī, even if such work is full of fault.
verses.transliteration: sahajaṁ karma kaunteya sadoṣam api na tyajet sarvārambhā hi doṣeṇa dhūmenāgnir ivāvṛtāḥ
verses.meaning: As fire is covered by smoke, every endeavor has faults; one should not abandon their natural work, even if faulty.

verses.sanskrit: असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः। नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां सन्न्यासेनाधिगच्छति॥
verses.translation: One who is unattached to the results of his work and who is indifferent to material pleasures attains the supreme perfection of renunciation.
verses.transliteration: asakta-buddhiḥ sarvatra jitātmā vigata-spṛhaḥ naiṣkarmya-siddhiṁ paramāṁ sannyāsenādhigacchati
verses.meaning: Detachment from work results and indifference to material pleasures leads to the supreme perfection of renunciation.

verses.sanskrit: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे। समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा॥
verses.translation: O son of Kuntī, learn from Me how one who has attained perfection can achieve the supreme goal, Brahman, the stage of supreme knowledge, by acting in the manner I shall now summarize for you.
verses.transliteration: siddhiṁ prāpto yathā brahma tathāpnoti nibodha me samāsenāiva kaunteya niṣṭhā jñānasya yā parā
verses.meaning: Arjuna, learn how one who has attained perfection reaches Brahman, the supreme goal of knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च। शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च॥
verses.translation: Being purified by his intelligence and controlling the mind with determination, giving up the objects of sense gratification, being freed from attachment and hatred,
verses.transliteration: buddhyā viśuddhayā yukto dhṛtyātmānaṁ niyamya ca śabdādīn viṣayāṁs tyaktvā rāga-dveṣau vyudasya ca
verses.meaning: One attains perfection by purifying their intelligence, controlling the mind, renouncing sense objects, and overcoming attachment and hatred.

verses.sanskrit: विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः। ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः॥
verses.translation: living in a secluded place, eating little, controlling the body, mind and power of speech, always engaged in trance and detached from material things,
verses.transliteration: vivikta-sevī laghvāśī yata-vāk-kāya-mānasaḥ dhyāna-yoga-paro nityaṁ vairāgyaṁ samupāśritaḥ
verses.meaning: Perfection is attained by living in seclusion, eating little, controlling body, mind, and speech, engaging in trance, and being detached.

verses.sanskrit: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम्। विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥
verses.translation: being freed from false ego, false strength, false pride, lust, anger, and the idea of possessing material things, one is situated in self-realization. That is the stage of Brahman.
verses.transliteration: ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ parigraham vimucya nirmamaḥ śānto brahma-bhūyāya kalpate
verses.meaning: The state of Brahman is attained by freeing oneself from false ego, strength, pride, lust, anger, and possessiveness, leading to self-realization and peace.

verses.sanskrit: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति। समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम्॥
verses.translation: One who is thus transcendentally situated at once realizes the Supreme Brahman. He never laments nor desires to have anything; he is equally disposed to every living entity. In that state he attains pure devotional service unto Me.
verses.transliteration: brahma-bhūtaḥ prasannātmā na śocati na kāṅkṣati samaḥ sarveṣu bhūteṣu mad-bhaktiṁ labhate parām
verses.meaning: A transcendentally situated person realizes Brahman, neither laments nor desires, is equal to all beings, and attains pure devotion to Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान् यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः। ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम्॥
verses.translation: One can understand the Supreme Personality of Godhead as He is only by devotional service. And when one is in full consciousness of the Supreme Lord by such devotion, he can enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.transliteration: bhaktyā mām abhijānāti yāvān yaś cāsmi tattvataḥ tato māṁ tattvato jñātvā viśate tad-anantaram
verses.meaning: The Supreme Personality of Godhead can be understood only through devotion. Full consciousness of the Lord through devotion enables entry into His kingdom.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः। मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम्॥
verses.translation: Though engaged in all kinds of activities, My pure devotee, under My protection, reaches the eternal and imperishable abode by My grace.
verses.transliteration: sarva-karmāṇy api sadā kurvāṇo mad-vyapāśrayaḥ mat-prasādād avāpnoti śāśvataṁ padam avyayam
verses.meaning: By Krishna's grace, His devotee, though engaged in all activities, attains the eternal, imperishable abode.

verses.sanskrit: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि सन्न्यस्य मत्परः। बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव॥
verses.translation: In all activities just depend upon Me, and work always under My protection. In such devotional service, be fully conscious of Me.
verses.transliteration: chetasā sarva-karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-paraḥ buddhi-yogam upāśritya mac-chittaḥ satataṁ bhava
verses.meaning: Depend on Krishna in all activities, work under His protection, and be fully conscious of Him in devotional service.

verses.sanskrit: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि। अथ चेत्त्वं न शृणोषि विनङ्क्ष्यसि॥
verses.translation: If you become conscious of Me, you will pass over all the obstacles of conditioned life by My grace. If, however, you do not work in such consciousness but act independently, you will be lost.
verses.transliteration: mac-chittaḥ sarva-durgāṇi mat-prasādāt tariṣyasi atha cet tvaṁ na śṛṇoṣi vinaṅkṣyasi
verses.meaning: Consciousness of Krishna helps one overcome all obstacles by His grace; acting independently leads to being lost.

verses.sanskrit: यद्यहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे। मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति॥
verses.translation: If you do not act according to My direction and do not fight, then you will be misguided. By your nature you will have to be engaged in fighting.
verses.transliteration: yad ahaṅkāram āśritya na yotsya iti manyase mithyaiṣa vyavasāyas te prakṛtis tvāṁ niyokṣyati
verses.meaning: If Arjuna, due to ego, decides not to fight, his own nature will compel him to do so.

verses.sanskrit: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा। कर्तुं नेच्छसि यत् मोहत् करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत्॥
verses.translation: Under illusion you are now refusing to act according to My direction. But compelled by your own nature, you will act all the same, O son of Kuntī.
verses.transliteration: svabhāva-jena kaunteya nibaddhaḥ svena karmaṇā kartuṁ necchasi yat mohāt kariṣyasy avaśo 'pi tat
verses.meaning: Arjuna's refusal to act is due to illusion; his own nature will compel him to act.

verses.sanskrit: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति। भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord is situated in everyone’s heart, O Arjuna, and is directing the wanderings of all living entities, who are seated as on a machine, made of the material energy.
verses.transliteration: īśvaraḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ hṛd-deśe 'rjuna tiṣṭhati bhrāmayan sarva-bhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā
verses.meaning: The Supreme Lord resides in everyone's heart, directing their wanderings as if they are on a machine made of material energy.

verses.sanskrit: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत। तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम्॥
verses.translation: O son of Bharata, surrender unto Him utterly. By His grace you will attain transcendental peace and the supreme and eternal abode.
verses.transliteration: tam eva śaraṇaṁ gaccha sarva-bhāvena bhārata tat-prasādāt parāṁ śāntiṁ sthānaṁ prāpsyasi śāśvatam
verses.meaning: Surrender to Him wholeheartedly to attain transcendental peace and the supreme, eternal abode by His grace.

verses.sanskrit: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया। विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु॥
verses.translation: Thus I have explained to you the most confidential of all knowledge. Deliberate fully on this, and then do what you wish to do.
verses.transliteration: iti te jñānam ākhyātaṁ guhyād guhya-taraṁ mayā vimṛśyaitad aśeṣeṇa yathecchasi tathā kuru
verses.meaning: Krishna has revealed the most confidential knowledge. Arjuna is asked to deliberate on it fully and then act as he chooses.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः। इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम्॥
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord says: My dear Arjuna, because you are My very dear friend, I am speaking to you My supreme instruction, the most confidential knowledge of all. Hear this from Me, for it is for your benefit.
verses.transliteration: sarva-guhyatamaṁ bhūyaḥ śṛṇu me paramaṁ vacaḥ iṣṭo 'si me dṛḍham iti tato vakṣyāmi te hitam
verses.meaning: Because Arjuna is His dear friend, Krishna reveals the most confidential knowledge, His supreme instruction, for Arjuna's benefit.

verses.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु। मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे॥
verses.translation: Always think of Me, become My devotee, worship Me and offer Me homage. You will surely come to Me. I promise you this because you are My very dear friend.
verses.transliteration: man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru mām evaiṣyasi satyaṁ te pratijāne priyo 'si me
verses.meaning: Krishna advises Arjuna to think of Him, be His devotee, worship Him, and offer Him homage, promising that Arjuna will come to Him.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वा सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥
verses.translation: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.
verses.transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śaraṇaṁ vraja ahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna urges Arjuna to abandon all forms of dharma and surrender solely to Him, promising liberation from all sins and freedom from fear.

verses.sanskrit: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन। न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति॥
verses.translation: This confidential knowledge may not be explained to those who are not austere, or devoted, or engaged in devotional service, nor to one who is envious of Me.
verses.transliteration: idaṁ te nātapaskāya nābhaktāya kadācana na cāśuśrūṣave vācyaṁ na ca māṁ yo 'bhyasūyati
verses.meaning: Krishna states that this sacred knowledge should not be imparted to those who lack austerity, devotion, or a desire to serve, nor to those who are envious of Him.

verses.sanskrit: य इमं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति। भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः॥
verses.translation: For one who explains this supreme secret to the devotees, pure devotional service is guaranteed, and at last he will come back to Me.
verses.transliteration: ya imaṁ paramaṁ guhyaṁ mad-bhakteṣv abhidhāsyati bhaktiṁ mayi parāṁ kṛtvā mām evaiṣyaty asaṁśayaḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna declares that whoever reveals this profound secret to His devotees will develop pure devotion and ultimately return to Him.

verses.sanskrit: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः। भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि॥
verses.translation: There is no servant in this world more dear to Me than he, nor will there ever be one more dear.
verses.transliteration: na ca tasmān manuṣyeṣu kaścin me priya-kṛttamaḥ bhavitā na ca me tasmād anyaḥ priya-taro bhuvi
verses.meaning: Krishna affirms that no one among humans is more dear to Him than the one who conveys this message, and none will ever be.

verses.sanskrit: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः। ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः॥
verses.translation: And I declare that he who studies this sacred conversation of ours worships Me by his intelligence.
verses.transliteration: adhyeṣyate ca ya imaṁ dharmyaṁ saṁvādam āvayoḥ jñāna-yajñena tenāham iṣṭaḥ syām iti me matiḥ
verses.meaning: Krishna believes that whoever studies this righteous dialogue between them intellectually worships Him.

verses.sanskrit: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः। सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम्॥
verses.translation: And one who listens with faith and without envy becomes free from sinful reactions and attains to the auspicious planets where the pious dwell.
verses.transliteration: śraddhāvān anasūyaś ca śṛṇuyād api yo naraḥ so 'pi muktaḥ śubhāṁl lokān prāpnuyāt puṇya-karmaṇām
verses.meaning: Krishna states that even someone who listens to this with faith and без envy is liberated from sin and reaches the realms of the righteous.

verses.sanskrit: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा। कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय॥
verses.translation: O Arjuna, O conqueror of wealth, have you heard this with an attentive mind? And are your ignorance and illusions now dispelled?
verses.transliteration: kaccid etac chrutaṁ pārtha tvayāikāgreṇa cetasā kaccid ajñāna-sammohaḥ pranaṣṭas te dhanañjaya
verses.meaning: Krishna inquires whether Arjuna has listened attentively and whether his ignorance and delusions have been dispelled.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत। स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव॥
verses.translation: Arjuna said: My illusion is now dispelled. My memory has been recovered by Your grace. I am now firm and free from doubt and am prepared to act according to Your instructions.
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca naṣṭo mohaḥ smṛtir labdhā tvat-prasādān mayācyuta sthito 'smi gata-sandehaḥ kariṣye vacanaṁ tava
verses.meaning: Arjuna replies that his illusion is dispelled, his memory restored by Krishna's grace, and he is now resolved to follow Krishna's commands.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच। इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः। संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम्॥
verses.translation: Sañjaya said: Thus have I heard this wonderful dialogue between Kṛṣṇa and the son of Pṛthā. And so thrilling was this message that my hair stood on end.
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca ity ahaṁ vāsudevasya pārthasya ca mahātmanaḥ saṁvādam imam aśrauṣam adbhutaṁ roma-harṣaṇam
verses.meaning: Sanjava recounts hearing this marvelous dialogue between Krishna and Arjuna, which caused his hair to stand on end.

verses.sanskrit: व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतुवानिमं गुह्यमहं परम्। योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम्॥
verses.translation: By the mercy of Vyāsa, I have heard these most confidential talks directly from the master of all mysticism, Kṛṣṇa, who was personally speaking.
verses.transliteration: vyāsa-prasādāc chrutavān imaṁ guhyam ahaṁ param yogaṁ yogeśvarāt kṛṣṇāt sākṣāt kathayataḥ svayam
verses.meaning: Sanjava explains that by the grace of Vyasa, he heard these highly confidential teachings directly from Krishna, the master of all mysticism.

verses.sanskrit: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम्। केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः॥
verses.translation: O King, as I repeatedly recall this wondrous dialogue between Kṛṣṇa and Arjuna, I take pleasure, being thrilled at every moment.
verses.transliteration: rājan saṁsmṛtya saṁsmṛtya saṁvādam imam adbhutam keśavārjunayoḥ puṇyaṁ hṛṣyāmi ca muhur muhuḥ
verses.meaning: Sanjava expresses his continuous joy and thrill as he repeatedly remembers the sacred dialogue between Krishna and Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः। विस्मयो मे महान् राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः॥
verses.translation: O King, as I further recall the wonderful form of Lord Kṛṣṇa, I am struck with greater wonder, and I rejoice again and again.
verses.transliteration: tac ca saṁsmṛtya saṁsmṛtya rūpam atyadbhutaṁ hareḥ vismayo me mahān rājan hṛṣyāmi ca punaḥ punaḥ
verses.meaning: Sanjava describes his repeated amazement and joy upon recalling the marvelous form of Lord Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः। तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम॥
verses.translation: Wherever there is Kṛṣṇa, the master of all mystics, and wherever there is Arjuna, the supreme archer, there will also certainly be opulence, victory, extraordinary power, and morality. That is my opinion.
verses.transliteration: yatra yogeśvaraḥ kṛṣṇo yatra pārtho dhanur-dharaḥ tatra śrīr vijayo bhūtir dhruvā nītir matir mama
verses.meaning: Sanjava concludes that wherever Krishna, the master of all mystics, and Arjuna, the supreme archer, are present, there will undoubtedly be opulence, victory, power, and righteousness.
